Summary: We primarily chose this boutique-type hotel for its location. Within seconds of the sands of the Pacific Ocean and minutes to the Newport Beach Pier and lots of restaurants, shops, and bars, we really enjoyed the service that we received and the amenities that this location offered. We enjoyed our time!

Great location, literally steps to the beach. Our room was clean and spacious, we had the mariner spa and it worked out just fine for the four of us (parents and 2 teens). There are lots of places to shop and eat within walking distance and super friendly and helpful staff with beach umbrellas, towels, toys and bikes to help yourself in the lobby as well as coffee/ tea/ hot chocolate/water and fruit.
Room tip:
Parking appears limited, we took an Uber to this beach so did not have a car. 
Also does not...

Summary: I was very surprised by just how much I enjoyed my stay at the Newport Beach Hotel.  Not only were the management team very friendly, they were informative and made us feel welcomed.  The room was very neat and clean, and comfortable.  They also had all the needed amenities for enjoying the beach, conveniently located in the lobby, but out of the way.  I will return and stay here in the future.
Room tip: Make sure to reserve you parking spot in advance, especially if you have a large vehicle.

Summary: I love my stay at Newport Beach Hotel and I would definitely stay here again.  The location was beyond fantastic, especially for the price, the staff were friendly and helpful and they have beach gear you can check out so you don't have to bring your own.  The jetted soaking tub was wonderful, but the shower could have had a little better water pressure.  My only three complains are:  1. There is no noise insulation.  You hear everything.  People in the hallways, people in the rooms next door, the cleaning staff.  Literally everything.  One of the nights I was there someone in a neighboring room locked themselves out of their room and since its as past midnight there was no one at the front desk to let them in.  So they waited in the hallway until about 1:30am talking extremely

Stayed here for 3 nights whilst on business. Rooms were very clean, the bed was very comfy and this is a lovely hotel. It is right on the beach and they offer chairs etc to take, I didn’t have any downtime to make use of this though. The only negatives were the hot water took ages and could have done with more breakfast options

This is a small, 20-room hotel that offers the best beachfront experience.  They have the best staff ever.  Got to meet five of them and all had the same friendly, upbeat attitude and ready to assist with any needs - immediately!  The room was neat and clean, the beds are soft and luxurious.  They offer free loaner bikes, chairs, towels, etc for your enjoyment.  I'm so glad we chose that hotel.  Made our getaway just wonderful!!!  No hot tub but there is a jacuzzi tub in the room - very nice!
Room tip: Pay for parking when you book. They let you park before your room is ready. Parking is gated with...

Summary: This hotel located in Newport Beach directly facing the ocean and the beach is fantastic! The hotel is small and charming. A great place to stay!it’s location is within easy walking distance to all the restaurants and shops alongside the beach and pier.

We loved our stay here. The location is perfect, right on the beach. The hotel is so cute and beachy, we loved the vibe. We took the bikes out one day which was great!  The room was the best part. We stayed in The Mariner Spa room and I wish every hotel room I ever book was as cute and perfect. It was bright/beachy, very clean, the tub/shower was huge, and overall just so cozy.   Be sure to pay for a parking spot in the back, it's very easy/convenient !  Overall a fantastic experience, will absolutely be coming back!!
Room tip: We had The Mariner Spa and loved it for a couple !

Summary Heading: Charming hotel right on Newport Beach!
Summary: Lovely hotel right on the beach.  Enjoyed the views from the sitting areas...windows opened to let in the fresh ocean air along with the amazing beach and boardwalk views.  Enjoyed some of the extras....beach cruisers to ride along the boardwalk as well as beach chairs and towels.  Parking was a little tight; however, you had a spot in a secure parking area and parking is scarce in Newport.  Location was excellent, right on the boardwalk with easy walking to both the pier, restaurants and shops.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  We will be back!

Summary Heading: Perfect location and a great staff!
Summary: We stayed at the Newport Beach Hotel on May 16, 2023. The location really can't be beat. Parking is super convenient for beach parking. Tamara is really friendly. And you can't beat the free breakfast in the mornings to start your day. Room 101 has great ocean views, and room 116 has a perfect trundle bed if there's three of you. We will definitely be staying there again.

We stayed here for 2 days on our first trip to Newport.  It was well worth the price we paid.  You cannot beat the location across the street from the beach and restaurants and bars all steps away.  Loved they provided bikes to ride and beach chairs.  Room was little tight for 2 people, but we were rarely in it.  We also took advantage of their little sitting area overlooking the beach sipping wine on a windy afternoon.  Breakfast is included and it includes yogurt, hard boiled eggs, some fruit, pastries and coffee.  The staff was super helpful with suggestions.  We enjoyed our stay here very much.

We stayed in one of the suites which is just a short walk from the main building and it is well equipped and super close to the beach. The staff were super friendly although they don’t offer a 24hr reception service. The room itself did say on the description that it had a Bath but it didn’t. The complementary breakfast is good but they could think about including a few pastries maybe? The free access to beach towels and chairs is a great perk!

My husband travels to California for business quite often. He stumbled across this property quite a few years ago & it has become a regular hotel for him for a lot of good reasons. I join him on occasion for a change of scenery & relaxation. When we're together, we always book the Ocean Front Spa room because of the view & people watching. It is an older boutique hotel but it has always been clean & nice to see that they were doing some upgrades during our last stay. The best thing about this place is Kristina (Manager). She is so friendly & pleasant to deal with. She seems to go out of her way to make sure all of her guests are happy. She is the rock there & we just can't say enough great things about her. Looking forward to our next stay here.

We absolutely love to stay at the Newport Beach Hotel!!  The staff are warm and friendly.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  You can borrow their bicycles for an hour or for the day.  The location is perfect for walking to the bars, restaurants, and shopping.  Stay in the ocean front room, and you have the best view in Newport!!

We booked this stay with little knowledge of the area except it was near Disneyland. Well, it exceeded any expectations we had.it is a quaint boutique hotel in an unbeatable location. We were able to wander around Newport Beach and Balboa Island, ride bikes offered by the hotel, and enjoy the beach just steps from the hotel. The location is central to the beachfront community, there are good food options and things to see in all directions. We felt safe and comfortable. Our room was spotlessly clean and the jacuzzi tub was a treat after walking for miles. It was quiet though in the middle of the action on Halloween weekend. The staff was all kind and responsive. Several young people manned the desk in the evenings and they were respectful, friendly and helpful. It felt like home

I was surprised there were so many people at the beach late August. We parked the car and had a 2 night stay, we never moved the car. Everything we needed was within a 5 minute walk. The view from the King room is great. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was the 2 restaurants just outside that had outdoor seating because of Covid. The noise was substantial. However both restaurants are great and highly recommend them.

I would HIGHLY recommend anyone to stay at this beautiful hotel. The staff is very welcoming and friendly, the rooms are beautiful and literally just steps from the beach and many restaurants/ bars even on lockdown mostly everything in the surrounding area is open. The beds are super comfy and the jetted tubs are just the cherry in the top for a nice relaxing time.

I chose this hotel because of the ocean view and proximity to the beach which is the only thing this hotel has to offer unfortunately.   We came during covid and while I understand certain precautions need to be taken this hotel was ridiculous.  There was absolutely NO access to the lobby, you had to call when you arrived and they would meet you in the alley behind the hotel.   Parking is an extra fee in addition to the exorbitant amount you pay to stay here and is located about 100 yards behind the hotel.  It is suppose to be gated but it was not working so people could roam in and out at their leisure.   We were told check in was at 4pm but we had to wait until after 5pm for it to be cleaned.   Any time we needed extra towels or ice we had to call the lobby for them to bring

Our recent visit to the Newport Beach Hotel was wonderful! It is our first hotel stay since COVID happened and we were happy to see all the precautions that were taken to ensure safety. Though the hotel lobby was closed, a friendly staff member met us in the parking lot and escorted us to our room. Anything we needed was just a phone call away. We stayed in the Sailor Suite and it was perfect for us and our daughter. The suite was beautifully decorated and cozy. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We will definitely be returning!

We live inland about 20 mi, This is such a great little getaway. Had to do something for my son's eighth grade promotion, since he missed out with all the sports, spring break,  and all the pump and circumstance of his graduation. Couldn't fly to Mexico because of COVID, but this is like a vacation in my backyard. The people of Newport are great. The amenities of this place are as good as they're going to get on a beachfront resort I couldn't recommend it more highly. If you're from out of town, you'll lose your s*** on this hotel. The bathrooms are full luxury, and it is steps from the best beach in all of Southern California, and from some of the most legendary bars and pubs. Food options are great as well.

I called to be courteous and called the hotel know that i had to cancel and that they could rent the room out...but i was shocked how rude the person was on the phone. She made it clear that i was not getting my money back (which i knew i wasnt getting) and made me feel foolish. I thought this was a cool hotel until i heard from the people that work there.
Manager Response: Oh my gosh, we are all so sorry for your experience when calling the hotel. Please know that we all truly strive to ensure the highest level of hospitality for our guests at all times, and on this occasion we missed the mark. I will certainly be sharing your review and addressing with every member of the front desk team. Thank you so much for being so thoughtful to contact us and I very much hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you in the future.  Warmly, Kristina DeLorme Manager, Newport Beach Hotel

Summary: We love this hotel. The location is fantastic, close to everything. Kristina, the manager and her staffare outstanding. Breakfast is simple, everything you need. The view from upstairs in the common area is a great place to have a glass ofwine (which they can provide) and watch the sunset. We will definitely be back.

This hotel is right at the beach,across from the beach parking lot. Clean n comfortable rooms, I had a jacuzzi tub. The staff is beyond friendly and helpful, complimentary beach cruisers,beach chairs and an Awesome breakfast and buy a glass of wine or beer. It's a must!! The Best location with easy access to restaurants,bars and beach shopping.

We've all read a stones throw or steps from the beach but at this location you are literally on the beach. It also helps that on Halloween weekend it's in the low 90's and there's no surf so you can just wade in to the adjacent Pacific and conjure up images of the Mediterranean! Genteel staff throughout the property and an overall house atmosphere made for a very pleasant stay. Rooms in the main building are best.

Was excited about the location and pictures looked good, price was right.   Paper thin walls - got ZERO sleep tonight because a loud snorer directly on the other side of the wall my bed was up against. Right when I finally started dozing off with a White Noise app on full blast, a loud slam of a door shutting at 100 mph jolted me wide awake. Writing this review angrily at 4:30 AM.   Moreover, there was no electric outlet next to the bed. Nowhere near the bed, actually. It's 2019 - we all need to charge our phones and use them in bed at the same time. Extremely annoying.   Rooms are small, cramped.   Front desk staff is very nice. Continental breakfast is meh, but better than nothing.   But overall would NOT stay here again - avoid this place if you value actually sleeping.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments regarding our location and value. I am so sorry for your disappointment as we sincerely wish a wonderful stay for each of our guests. I certainly understand how a noisy neighbor would have impacted your stay and please know that our night manager would have willingly helped with addressing your situation. I hope we may have the opportunity to wow you in the future, should you return to Newport Beach. Warmly, Krisina DeLorme Manager, Newport Beach Hotel

Summary: My husband and I recently spent a weekend at Newport Beach and stayed at the Newport Beach Hotel.  We got a room with an ocean view and it did not disappoint.  The beach is steps from the hotel and the pier and restaurants are a short walk away.  You can sit in the chairs by the window and enjoy the views of the beach and beautiful sunset, or view the same from the jacuzzi tub which also has ocean views.  The room was quiet and comfortable and there is a great complimentary breakfast including beverages, muffins,toast, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, fruit and granola bars.  There is limited parking in the back so call ahead to make sure they have space available.   Otherwise there is parking nearby.  The only downside is the hotel is next to a restaurant which does a good

The Hotel is located on the Beach and surrounded by restaurants and bars, a short walk to the pier. We stayed in the 1 bedroom condo (which is behind the hotel) was clean, spacious with a well stocked kitchen. The hotel supplies bikes, beach toys, chairs, boogie boards, umbrellas and towels for their guests. A continental breakfast is served, beer and wine is available for purchase. I would stay at this hotel again

Summary Heading: Anniversary on the Beach & Corn Dogs
Summary: First time staying here. Celebrating Anniversary. Shared Corn Dogs on the beach. The room was very clean and well decorated. Comfortable bed, the springs could use some WD-40 but all-in-all a wonderful stay. Lol The shower was terrific, very spacious with his and hers sides and stone flooring to relax your feet. It was like a spa experience. The kitchen is fully stocked like home. Fresh coffee and tea. Nice parking area with key code entrance.  We are definitely coming back!

The location is the best in NPB -- right on the beach, short walk to the pier and to all the restaurants. Nice touches, such as free bike rental, free beach chairs and towels. But the best part -- the customer service! Jessie was just the best -- thank you, Jessie!

Beautiful, central location right on the beach with lots of restaurants and bars surrounding the hotel. Homely decor and clean rooms. Amazing staff - so friendly and welcoming. Small but lovely complimentary breakfast. Would stay here again when visiting Newport Beach.

Summary Heading: This B & B will have you buzzing
Summary: I stayed at this boutique bed & breakfast hotel on Lido in Newport bc I was having some construction done on my house. I reserved a Regatta King Spa room w/ a bit of a view.  The plusses are the updated motif, and close proximity to the water, good bars & some average restaurants. The minuses are the small parking lot and lack on a fridge in the room.  I'd stay here again if I was having work done on my house. However, if you are in from out of town, this spot works very well if you want to hang by the beach. Popular tourist attractions like Disneyland and Knotts are a bit of a hike.  Remove review draft

Summary Heading: Amazing time at Newport Beach Hotel
Summary: My family and I stayed for 4 nights in June, 2018, and were very happy with our visit.  The rooms were fine, although not luxurious by any means. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendlier.  They could use another person on dity though. They always seemed to be short-staffed. Also, the parking lot in front of the hote rakes away from the ambience. But free Bikes and beach items, location, and extras provided make up for the negatives.

Summary Heading: This photos of this hotel on-line are not even the hotel we stayed in!
Summary: This photos of this hotel on-line are not even the hotel we stayed in! There was maybe one staff member at any one time who didn't care at all about the guests. The road outside was being paved so we couldn't even get to the parking lot - twice. Once we had to leave our car on the main road and no one cared at all. I was told the road would be finished in an hour so just wait. The hour turned out to be36 hours! The lobby opened up on an abandoned restaurant. Hence the photos on the site that they haven't taken down. Also the road was so loud at night - forget thinking you're on a beach. You're not! I would never stay there again.
Manager Response: ATTENTION: WRONG PROPERTY REVIEW - This reviewer did not stay at this property and left this review on the incorrect hotel. TripAdvisor is aware, and is working to resolve and remove.

Summary: I have stayed at hotels all over the world but this was by far the worst experience I have ever had in my entire life !!  We came to Orange County California for the weekend for business reasons  We completed our check in earlier in the day with Marci who was extremely helpful As our room was not ready Marci asked us to come back later which was no problem At 5.30 we returned & Natalie was now at the front desk Natalie took 10 minutes to find our reservation again & kept asking what name was it booked in ?? Eventualy Natalie took us to our room & emphatically stated “that you have booked a very nice room” Upon opening the door we were COMPLETELY HORRIFIED !! The room was filled with empty pizza boxes, empty & half full bottles of wine & beer & numerous used glasses - obviously

I stayed here just for one evening but found the place to be friendly, comfortable and very well located.   The hotel is on the beach front road so you have the boardwalk straight outside. There’s a cycle path along the beach (and the hotel has bikes to borrow) so you can have a great ride or walk, and enjoy the wonderful sunsets.   Arriving I had a wonderfully friendly welcome. The rooms aren’t enormous (they’re not small!) but they are comfortable with a great shower / jacuzzi in mine.   Breakfast is included - bagels, cereal and a few other bits and pieces - but how much more do you want?   And finally there is a superb sea food restaurant straight next door (Fly N Fish).  Very much recommended!

Booked through expedia and the site booked me on the wrong date (defaulted to the day I booked not the day I wanted to stay). Expedia said they corrected it same day but it never got corrected and I was charged for as a no show for that date. I had to stay there for a business event so booked again. The hotel manager refused to refund me for the expedia mistake as did Expedia. The place is old dirty noisy overpriced and the staff are rude to say the least. Also charge 20.00 a night for parking in tiny lot no big cars. It's a mess. Do not stay here.
Manager Response: I can certainly understand your frustration in dealing with Expedia regarding this issue. As we discussed over the telephone, reservations made through online travel agents are out of the hotel's hands. We truly are unable to make changes and are reliant on Expedia to move or cancel a reservation, it should also be noted that they hold the reservation deposit. As you mention, Expedia made the error and did not follow up with the cancellation and refund. Although Expedia does require that guests make any and all cancellations, because they had record of your call, I was able to intervene on your behalf and secure a full refund for you from them. I am pleased I was able to make things right for you and and so appreciated your kind acknowledgement.  We always encourage guests to book directly with the hotel as we could have easily rectified a situation such as this for you.   I hope we can welcome you back in the future.

Summary: We have stayed at the Newport Beach Hotel on and off for many years, each room is a little different. Some have windows, some do not, some have fireplaces and some do not. Sadly only two of the room actually have a view of the beach. But the location more than makes up for it.   All of the rooms are on the second floor, there is no elevator. You can access from the beach side or in the back where they have a very tight parking lot with electronic gates. The stairs in the back (parking) are a little scary.   Its surrounded by some fun old restaurants and bars that have been a part of Newport nightlife for generations. Mutt's, Beachball, and Blackie's (coldest beer anywhere) are great places to grab a drink and watch a game or munch on some local fare. Most places are pretty

My daughter and I stayed at this property for two days this November.  The bed was comfy and the tub enormous!   We really enjoyed the cruiser bikes and the tasty breakfast.   The hotel has a upbeat feel and a relaxed vibe.  We loved it.   We also forgot a dental retainer and the manager was very kind and found it!  The location can't be beat if you want to walk right outside to the beach.

Summary Heading: A hidden surprise in a perfect location!
Summary: We enjoyed every aspect of this hotel.  The front desk staff was extremely service oriented and helped us feel like we were right at home.  The breakfast is perfect -- especially the eggs and steel-cut oats.  We enjoyed having towels and other beach items available for us to get right to the beach without wasting any time.  We loved being able to get beach cruisers and head up the boardwalk and to Balboa Island.  The rooms are nice and the shared space is cozy and very nicely decorated.  Overall, Newport Beach Hotel is a new favorite!

Location of this hotel is just great. You are literally on the beach. You can feel the ocean breeze. Rooms are clean and full of the beachy vibe. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Due to the confusion about the room reservation, they gave us an upgrade. Very kind of them. Overall, charming small hotel.

Walking into the funky beachfront hotel, we were greeted by Christina, who could not have been lovelier. She checked us in, told us about some excellent local happenings and hotel offerings, and really made or stay enjoyable. Her colleague Marcie kept up the service level. The housekeeping crew are also excellent and hard working.   A casual, no frills breakfast of cereals and breads is nice to have to start the day.   Our favorite feature is the use of hotel bicycles - included in the stay. Riding bikes on the Newport boardwalk is magical. The hotel also provides towels, umbrellas and beach chairs. All important for a beach stay.  The location is amazing - right on the beach and next to classic Newport eateries like Mutt Lynch’s and the newer Dory Deli, which is excellent.

Summary Heading: Welcoming hotel with perfect location and beautiful views
Summary: Newport beach hotel is a really cosy and beautiful hotel right by the beach. Its almost as if you are at home, or at least your dream home ;)   The staff is super friendly and rooms and all other hotel areas are beautiful in classic Newport style.  The hotel has bikes that you can borrow for free, its an amazing way to see the area and enjoy the beaches.   This is a must stay in Newport Beach! Highly recommended!

Everything was great. Room and location was awesome. However there was no mini fridge and we didn’t care to hear about the front desk attendant, Natalie’s suicidal and alcoholic husband every time we came down stairs. Other then that they supplied beach toys, towel service and biggie boards which was nice.

My husband stays here on business trips & decided to join him on this trip. I can see why he loves this place. We stayed at this boutique hotel for 5 nights. The first 4 nights were in room 101 which was an ocean front room. Loved the large windows that can be opened to feel the breeze & people watch. The last night, we had to move rooms due to a pre-booking that we were fully aware of. They offered to move our luggage if were were going to be out for the day. We moved to room 120 which was on the 2nd floor of rear building. It was very spacious & overlooked side street. Staff were friendly. Good continental breakfast (breads, cereals, oatmeal, granola, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, coffee, tea). They offer free use of bikes, beach chairs, beach umbrellas, beach towels. Found it to

We love staying at the Newport Beach Hotel!!!   Our oceanfront room was PERFECT!!!  We enjoyed opening the huge windows and watching the surf + surfers. The staff was friendly and accommodating,  and our room clean, sunny, and quiet at night.  We had EXCEPTIONAL meals at the Flying Fish next store.  Thanks ALL for a GREAT visit!!!

TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. TOTALLY UNORGANIZED! I booked this hotel on the phone. They sent a confirmation on 12/20/17. I canceled the SAME DAY because my husband had booked another place without me knowing. The hotel charged the full amount  even though I had canceled within 24 hours. When I  called them they said they never received my email. When I told the I had actually send TWO  emails to cancel (and then forward those emails as proof), they still insisted they never go them . And still insisted the charge was valid. I responded that it can't be my fault that their reservation system is  not working (since BOTH emails were never received... ). They still didn't want to refund me. This is highly  unprofessional.  Travelers need to know their business acumen  before making a
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize for the confusion regarding this reservation. Although the guest did forward emails showing she cancelled her reservation, they were sent from a different name than on the original reservation and were caught by our spam filter. As soon as we discovered the matter, we contacted the guest and processed a full refund. We always ask that guests contact the inn by phone when amending or cancelling a reservation so that we may provide a cancellation number and avoid any confusion.  Once again, we truly apologize for any frustration caused to the guest and are thankful we had the opportunity to discuss the situation directly with her and earn back her trust.

Summary: We stayed in this little hotel for two nights and loved it the minute we walked through the door! Not only does it have an incredible location facing the beach along the pathway but it is also friendly, casual and charming.  The bedrooms are crisp and clean painted in grey with white trim and white bed linens and towels. The lobby has big casement windows that open up to the ocean breezes where you can sit and enjoy a beverage while watching the waves break along the shore. We loved the staff all of whom were friendly, helpful and fun. Kristina, the hotel manager, was delightful and so welcoming. We hope to return to the Newport Beach Hotel and will certainly recommend it to our friends.

I and my wife stayed here for our anniversary.  They had their special pricing on and we stayed for 2 nights and loved it.  The staff is the friendliest staff in the business.  They are accommodating and happy.  They make your stay really special.  We arrived early and our room was ready so we checked in.  We spent the whole day walking the beach and pier.  We also rode bikes along the beach.  They know every restaurant in the area and can tell you the best places to go.  It is a great place to stay.

This is a very cool Hotel ,old style service .Is right on the beach front .The view is excellent of the ocean .The rooms are big . We were able to check out at 5pm before long haul flight back to New Zealand .I will stay here again .Restaurant right next door .

We had reserved one of the standard rooms, but when we arrived they gave us one of the ocean view rooms since they were not otherwise occupied, a smart move.  The rooms are on the small side but the location is wonderful.  The hotel is right on Newport Beach with a municipal parking lot in between,  I think in the summer time this could be a problem with noise, but in early January it was great.   A continental breakfast is included and the staff was helpful, making me a fresh pot of decaf on the first day and then doing it again the second morning as soon as he saw me come down.   The public areas could use some updating, the carpet upstairs is particularly worn.  The off street parking is helpful.  We would be happy to return.

We only had one night and wanted a beachfront hotel. The hotel is right across the street (mostly just a parking area so not a busy road) from the beach. We arrived a bit early for check in. but our room was ready! (They also offered to hold our luggage if it wasn't ready) Our room was lovely. Big comfy bed, fireplace, daybed, jetted tub, and walk in shower. I loved that the bath area was down a few steps. It was such a homey feel. We were pretty tired from our Disney visit so we went to bed early and it was very quiet all night. We also slept in and missed the breakfast. There are many shops, restaurants, etc all within a short walking distance. This part of Newport Beach is just the best. I wish we had a few more days of our beach stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

The location was great, and the remodel was very nicely done. It is a small hotel with small rooms. We had one of the bigger rooms and it was great. There is an overhead light right outside the door in front of our room that was very bright, but it was ok. Lots of stairs, no elevator. It is not handicap friendly, but if you are able to walk stairs it is a nice little hotel. The continental breakfast was nothing fancy, Muffins, English Muffins, Bagels, Bread, hard boiled eggs and cereal. But it was fair for the price. Lots of little restaurants and pubs in walking distance. Great food in the area. Would definitely consider staying here again.
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay at the Newport Beach Hotel.  We do have a mobility and hearing accessible room.  Please feel free to call me should you wish to book that room for a future visit.  We look forward to having you stay with us again. Kristina DeLorme Manager

Summary Heading: Not what we expected - should have looked longer
Summary: We spent other nights at Four Sisters connected 'luxury' inns for the $400+ a night (plus $20 parking) we paid and were shocked when we arrived. We planned on traveling the coast and wanted a suite so booked here for a quick NB over-night stay. Our room was ready a bit earlier than check-in which was nice (once we found someone). Meager amount of furniture for a suite. The worst was an overwhelming, sickly sweet smell of air freshener that must commonly be used to cover up odors of previous guests. We became ill, left and didn't return for six hours in order to get some fresh air. The smell by then was still obvious and a/c didn't help so we slept with the ceiling fan on. Next morning we had the mediocre breakfast and immediately left. The folks are fine, the beach is close -
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience, and for your kind comments regarding our staff and location. Please know that we truly strive to ensure a wonderful experience for our guests, and I am dismayed at your disappointment. I very much wish I could have addressed your issues while you were visiting with us as I am confident we could have found a room that better met your needs. We strive to have our hotel policies and amenities clearly stated on the  confirmation, as well as the website, as they do differ slightly between properties. We hope you will choose to stay at one of our other locations in the future. Warmly, Kristina DeLorme Manager, Newport Beach Hotel

Summary: The staff and owner of this property are all really fantastic people.  I was a bit concerned when I walked in as the noise from the two bars next door was really loud.  But - I didnt get woken up once over a 4 night stay over the weekend.  I was with my 9 year old so we were in bed fairly early and still no sound bugged us.  As the pics clearly show, at least some of the rooms dont have windows.  We didnt mind as both the 2nd floor and main levels had common areas with seating to sit with a drink or breakfast and look over the beach.  Breakfast is decent with some healthy options which I found refreshing.  TV had tons of channels, beds were comfy, and the amount of beach stuff (chairs, towels, toys, umbrellas, boogie boards, etc) you could use for free was fantastic.

The location is great. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room is super clean. And although our room although super clean and cute, it only had a very tiny window that could not be opened because it looked out over the next buildings loud generator (not much the hotel can do about that). I think most of the other rooms would have been fine but ours was hot because of it.

We have stayed here 5 times before and they never let us down. Christina and her staff do a great job providing everything you need and nothing you don't.  Bicycles, boogie boards, beach chairs, umbrellas, you name it they have it. This is THE PLACE to go if you want to go in the water, and why wouldn't you??It's Newport Beach!!Great restaurants within walking distance, great location. We park our car and walk everywhere. We just finished four nights and before leaving booked our next stay. If you are looking for a resort this isn't it, this place is about having fun and getting sand everywhere.

Summary Heading: This hotel has it all. So Welcoming!
Summary: This hotel definitely is at the top of my list for a great place to stay. Kristina assisted us at check in and gave us the most pleasant and friendly welcome and assistance throughout our entire stay. Thank you!

The Newport Beach Hotel is in the ideal location for your visit to Newport Beach.  Really, you just walk out of the hotel directly to the beautiful Pacific Ocean.  The hotel is also right along the boardwalk with tons of shops and restaurants a few steps away.  Also, the harbor is a few steps away. The rooms were fine - small, but who is going to spend their time in the room.  The staff was wonderful.  The hotel offers beach towels, chairs and bikes free of charge for their guests. The only real downside of the stay was the continental breakfast.  Not a quality, fresh selection of choices for breakfast while we were there. I will recommend the Newport Beach Hotel to friends and family, and I will definitely stay there in the future.

My sister & I spent 2 nights & 3 days at this cozy hotel. Only 15 rooms but they've got all you need. First, the location is fabulous! We walked to the pier, you cross the parking lot and there's the beach. Lots of places to eat , shop & drink. The rooms are very comfortable, the beds and pillows perfect. Clean, bright. They only have 2 rooms that have a view to the ocean. We had no view but we still loved it. The hotel provides you with beach towels, chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards and bicycles. All at no extra cost. The people at the front desk are awesome, they try to help any way possible, they even let us borrow all the beach gear after we checked out! They also include breakfast in the price. It's nothing spectacular, cereal, bagels, coffee, hard boiled eggs, boxed juice.

We love to stay at the Newport Beach Hotel.  The accommodations are charming, the staff is personable and helpful, and the location couldn't be better.  Bikes, chairs, boogie boards, beach towels are all complimentary.  We've stayed a few times, and will definitely stay again.  It's our destination hotel when we got to Newport Beach.

Great service, room, location, amenities. Only wish they had an in room safe to secure items in the room. High traffic area especially on the weekends. About 45 min from LAX. Lots of bars and restaurants in walking distance.

The Newport Beach Hotel offers great rooms right on the boardwalk. Wonderful service, great cont'l breakfast, and there is private parking around the block, which is a plus in this busy area. They offer happy hour in the lobby so you can enjoy the ocean breezes in a warm inviting living room area. Will definitely return.

Not due to a lack of words, I will keep this short and sweet. I have had the good fortune to travel the world. I have stayed in the most prestigious hotels that the industry has to offer. In my 40 years I have never experienced perfect service until I found this little gem. The staff stoped at nothing to insure my stay was nothing short of perfection. I could go on and on. Do yourself a favor... if you are anywhere near the Pacific Ocean, make This hotel a must on your list of places to stay. You guys made my trip! Thank you!!!

Summary Heading: Adorable Hotel, right on the beach!
Summary: We were just here for one night, but will definitely come back again. Super friendly staff! Cute, well appointed room. It's right on the beach, and within walking distance of restaurants, bars and shops. A quaint, laid back boutique hotel.

My husband and I enjoyed a fabulous week at the Newport Beach Hotel. Situated right on the beach near restaurants and recreation was the perfect getaway. The staff is helpful and friendly. The breakfast and free bike rental, beach chairs, toys and umbrellas were a nice addition. We'll definitely come back.

This is a very cute hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff, and did I mention the location?  Right off the walkway and the beach.  A few steps from restaurants and shopping.  We rented bikes from the hotel (included in the price) and biked around all of Balboa Island.  It's also a plus not to have to worry about parking at the beach!  We're already planning on going again next summer!

Summary Heading: This is a great place to stay.  The beach is just across the sidewalk and it is a great hotel.
Summary: I and my wife stayed here for just one night.  We did however arrive early and the wonderful desk clerk allowed us to park in the parking lot and enjoy the beach and gave us a couple of bikes to ride.  We were notified by cell phone when our room was ready and checked in.  The room is really clean and comfortable.  But the best part of this hotel is the staff.  The staff is the friendliest staff I have ever met.  They help with every concern and make your stay really enjoyable.  It is a wonderful place to stay.

Recently, I stayed at the Newport Beach Hotel for four nights.  Before my arrival, I received a call that they would upgrade me to a suite if I was interested....and of course I jumped on the chance to stay in one of their suites.  The owner and staff were very friendly and helpful.  The owner showed me to my suite which did not disappoint...what a beautiful room!  The hotel is literally right on the beach and walking distance to a lot of great places to eat!  I would stay here again and recommend it to travelers who want close access to the beach!

We loved this place! Our room was very nice and very quiet. We didn't have a room facing the ocean, but there was a cute little nook with couches a few steps away where a couple could enjoy a glass of wine or three. The best thing, though, was the bikes! The hotel provides very well maintained bikes that we used for two long rides on Newport's wonderful beach bike path. also, the breakfast was nice. Fresh fruit, cereals,yogurt, pastries. We'll be back!

Great place to stay!  Wonderful breakfast,  superb location! Parking!  Rooms were huge.  Honestly would stay here again in a second. Owner was extremely friendly. Have lots of things for free rental: chairs, umbrellas, etc.  Spend the money and stay here!

Summary Heading: Every thing works at this place
Summary: Spent one night at the Newport Beach Hotel and would have loved to stay longer. With an excellent location right on the beach, the hotel has a welcoming main floor, with tables overlooking the Pacific, a games area, a TV area and a bar. You often see this plan in European hotels. The second floor houses the fifteen rooms, which I found well organized and spacious. No elevator. Parking behind the hotel is an added bonus in an area where parking is difficult. Breakfast certainly hit the spot.

Summary Heading: Didn't stay here but had a pleasant experience
Summary: My husband and I had been at Disneyland for a few days and had a few hours to pass before our flight from John Wayne Airport. We decided to go to Newport Beach and randomly chose this hotel as our Uber destination. We dragged our suitcases in and cheekily asked if they would hold them for us for a few hours. The Manager couldn't have been nicer and willingly kept our bags in her office, spending several minutes chatting wit us. We can only assume that this is indicative of the level of service at this sweet boutique hotel. Thank you!!

Summary Heading: Perfect beach location but old walls let sounds come right in.
Summary: This is the perfect Newport beach location with wonderful service, friendly people, and comfortable beds.  The only draw back is that the walls do not isolate from noise.  Even with the television going or playing music later on I could hear snoring and other noises from different rooms.  The heating and cooling system from the restaurant next door also hummed through the floors and walls as long as it was open. If you are a heavier sleeper this will not be a problem.

All front end folks were awesome & extremely helpful. Great / Beautiful location.    Only criticisms are:  Bathtub difficult for bathing kids & would be nearly impossible for older people.  AND Baseboards need to be wiped down.

This place is right on the ocean very cute and clean. Stay in one of the ocean facing rooms. The restaurant next door is awesome try the scallops. If you are in Newport Beach I recommend it. Five stars from me.

This boutique hotel puts you right on the beach. i have stayed here a couple of times and if you book early, you can get the oceanfront king room. I believe there are only 2. This is an exceptionally romantic location that is very difficult to beat. The other hotels in the area look great on the web but truly do not compare.

Summary Heading: Beachy, comfy, cozy, spacious one-bedroom suite in prime location!
Summary: My husband and I stayed in a one-bedroom suite and it was unbelievable! We are born and raised in Orange County and know Newport Beach well and wanted to get away for a private, romantic staycation. We couldn't have been happier! The service was excellent, the space and one-bedroom layout was ideal - large, spacious, tasteful beach furnishings and decor that felt homey yet luxurious at the same time. I adored the soft and restful bed and haven't received that good night of a sleep in a long time. But to top it off the location was to die for. It is literally right by the beach, pier, restaurants and bars. You can basically see from your window the crashing waves, yet be in the midst of the fun hustle and bustle of Newport. Take it from a local's perspective - this was a perfect

This cozy hotel is right on the beach and literally steps from the sand. We have been coming to this hotel for a few years because of the views, location and the character. We had the pleasure of staying here four nights in an ocean front room. They only have two ocean fronts and they are remarkable with views of the ocean and Newport Pier. The rooms are beautiful and clean. A special thank you to Gabby at the front desk who made our stay so memorable. If you want the best, this is it.

Summary Heading: My cool spot: classy, comfy, perfect
Summary: This place is just perfect . It's soberly sophisticated, recalling Italian charm of architecture in the details. I love the beautiful room with the bubble tub and it's soothing atmosphere.  Staff wonderful, breakfast can't be better. I have daydreamed here the most beautiful things ever, for a creative mind like me that's priceless, thanks to the  comfort this boutique hotel has to offer.  Will be back soon. Thank You very much for having me here.

We stayed at the hotel one night only, sadly. Cozy hotel with so beautiful view, just next to the sea and the sun sets are so beautiful there. Sun sets down to the sea. Rooms are not big but enough and bathroom was open, separated with big window. If you need your privacy you can pul the curtains on. Breakfast does not offer much but if you want to have more places are nearby.

We were just thrilled when we found this little gem loaded with history and character, literally steps from the beach! What a great place to relax for two days before we headed to Disneyland!!   We took advantage of the free bike cruisers to explore the beachfront path as well as Balboa Island. We also loved being able to borrow the beach toys, beach towels, and boogie boards!  We were pleasantly surprised by the great continental breakfast!! Saved us so much time and money!! Christina the manager is absolutely phenomenal!!  Our room was spacious and the beds were super comfortable!!  I was a tad worried that the hotel wouldn't live up to the photos online, but we were not disappointed.

This is a nice little gem in a perfect location if you want to take in all the best Newport Beach has to offer. The location is directly adjacent to the beach just far enough away from the heavily trafficked tourist area but close enough to join the action any time you want. Just two doors down is Mutt Lynch's one of my all time favorite beach/sports bar. The hotel is clean, first class, and has everything you need for first class comfort.

We stopped by on an unplanned drive down the California coast. Gorgeous hotel with loads of character and homely touches. Impeccably clean, great size room, complimentary breakfast and comfortable bed finished off with friendly hospitality.

Super friendly and helpful. The perfect location for a beach break, 15 meters from the sand. Included are towels,bikes, boogie boards and breakfast. Walking distance to a wide range of eating choices and local sights.

The Newport Beach Boardwalk Hotel never disappoints. It is the best location. Great restaurants within walking distance and of course one of the best beaches in Orange County. Just finished our 7th stay, twice a year and will be back in 2017. The rooms are nice, the management great. They can supply Umbrellas Towels  Chairs  Bikes  Boogie boards And a nice breakfast that doesn't bog you down when you hit the waves. Great place!

I loved our trip to California and our stay in this hotel.  It is true that the hotel needs a little paint and cleaning and our room/bathroom were small.  BUT, the location certainly makes up for it!  We were right on the beach and very close to restaurants and shopping.  Parking is a nightmare if you want to park somewhere other than at the hotel.  The hotel provides beach towels, chairs, bikes, boogie boards, etc.....anything you need for the beach which was great.  The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Loved our stay here and would definitely visit again.

We had such a great weekend getaway! It's right on the beach and super close to restaurants. Our suite was way more than what we expected! It was very roomy and comfortable. The hotel provided beach chairs and beach towels, which was awesome!      The only downside was that the suites are not located right in front of the ocean. Parking was limited too. Other than that, I highly recommend anyone to say here. :)

We were here for a week and picked this hotel because of the location.  The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly.  My only negative is the Internet would cut off every 5 minutes and sometimes was non existent which is not always a bad thing when travelling with two kids. The hotel supplies everything for the beach so no need to bring anything and bikes when needed.  We will be definitely coming Back to this hotel.

We LOVED our stay at your hotel! Everyone was so genuinely nice and helpful! Our suite was so much more than we were expecting! We raised our kids renting a house every summer on Seashore and 40th St. Now that they are all grown it was nice to visit Newport again without the hassle of bringing everything needed for the beach! They have it all covered! Beach towels, chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards, bikes! Location can't be beat! Can't wait to visit again!

Perfect Location, Phenomenal room layout, staff is very helpful and goes out of their way to make sure you are happy with your stay.  No other hotel offers the proximity to the beach for the value in price.  Already reserved a week for next year!

Summary Heading: Lovely relaxing boutique hotel on the beach
Summary: We had room 101 which has a fantastic view of the beach and pier.  The room and bed was very comfortable.  Loved sitting at the window watching the action on the beach.  The complementary breakfast was good.  The boardwalk below the window can get noisy and there is a continuous stream of traffic going into the car park, but we enjoyed the atmosphere.  The shower was over the bath and could be difficult to get into if you have short legs like me!

Lovely bed &breakfast with seaview. Steps from the beach , right on the boardwalk close to restaurants, shops and bars. The room was clean and lovely decorated .Good breakfast. We were provided with beachtowels and beachchairs .Free parking . We had a great , relaxing time here.

Landed @ airport during the crazy heat wave..  it was HOT and after a business meeting in Anaheim we fled to the beach in Newport  with no reservations. We  used Trip Advisor and found the Newport Beach Hotel... and was fortunate to find 2 rooms available and @ a discount from rack rate... we experienced a 33 degrees drop in temperature and a cool breeze thru the large windows of the lobby of this boutique and very clean hotel. Rooms were nicely done.  Will stay again

Summary Heading: Right on the Beach, Right in the City, Right on the Price!
Summary: Stayed 4 nights and simply loved every minute. Location, Location, Location! You will be glad you stayed here. Not your overpriced corporate mega resort. Staff are so helpful! Room was beautiful, clean, quiet! Be sure to pay to park in lot.

So, I booked this place last minute and it turned out great!  The location absolutely cannot be beat.  Literally a minute walk to the beach.  Rooms were very cozy.  We stayed in the Pierpoint room which had a small window at the side with a view of the pier.  It wasn't spectacular because there was some sort of giant generator but it was still nice.  For more money you can book a room with a full ocean view.  But there aren't many of those so you probably have to book in advance.  They let you borrow beach towels, chairs, sand toys and they also loan bicycles.  But they do not have bicycles for children so I had to walk up the street to rent a child size bike but everything is close to the hotel so it was fine.  Dianne and Gabby were amazing staff members.  I was able to check

Stayed with my mom and sister and loved the spacious rooms. Enjoyed the bonus sitting area upstairs where we had a glass of wine and watched the sunset. Location was perfect. Fabulous place to stay and I can't wait to come back. Only wished I had booked more days, when I tried to increase length of stay they were booked solid, and I can understand why!

The employees were all terrific, the room was amazing best of all it was steps from the beach. We came for 4 days and 3 nights everyone was very nice and accommodating to our needs far beyond what we ever expected.

Perfect beachfront accommodation for our family. Great location..easy to park and beautiful cottage. Free breakfast was available...I would choose any one of the 4 sisters hotels. When we arrived early in the day we were offered opportunity to check in early!

Came here for two nights on a Californian road trip. It was our honeymoon and they upgraded us to a spa room, very much appreciated! Location is PERFECT, right on the beach. Rooms are amazing and we are already planning a loner stay next year.

I can't wait to go there again. Makes you feel like a Queen. Take me away..It's like magic, I like the Spa Room with Ocean View. I want to marry the Hotel. The views of the beach from he first floor lobby area and my room are great I will be back.

The hotel was in a great location. When we arrived the room was ready and very clean. The hotel staff was fabulous. They were willing to go out of the way to help the guests. Very friendly and always with a smile to keep the guests happy. We are glad that we got the hotel parking because it was almost impossible to find parking outside. The breakfast was not, nothing much to get excited about it. But there was coffee and tea available 24-hours a day. They had several beach bikes and they were free for hotels guests. That was a very nice compliment.  The hotel was in a nice location. But we couldn't find a lot of selections when it comes for food. There were few places within walking distance. You could take the hotel bike to ride to Balboa Pier which is about 2 miles from this

We chose this hotel for its proximity to the beach and near son who lives on Balboa Penninsula.  The hotel is magical and reminds us of the east coast beach hotels of Cape Cod and Nantucket.  The Manager Kristina (sp) and her staff are just amazing.  We stayed on night in a partial view room and another in oceanfront.  The views of the beach from first floor lobby area and second floor living room of ocean, surfers and sunset make this worth all 5 stars.  Cant wait to return. Thanks for the wonderful stay.

The location is great and the rooms are comfortable, although a bit claustrophobic. Some have no windows and are small. The staff is very accommodating. Be prepared to ask for the rooms to be serviced each day, otherwise they will not get done. They have free WiFi but it is weak and kicks you off frequently. They provide a continental breakfast - but it is sparse. Overall, I recommend this hotel for people that are not staying long enough to rent a beach house (the hotel is more expensive) and that want to be in the center of the beach action in Newport.

Literally steps from the beach-maybe ten! A great place to relax. Instead of driving around town, use the free bikes to explore, or enjoy the beachside path on foot. Very friendly and helpful staff. The sitting areas provide ample beach views. The skylights are a nice touch, and the private parking is appreciated. My husband went around the corner for a hot breakfast, but I was completely satisfied with the continental options. I was worried the hotel wouldn't live up to the photos online, but I was not disappointed. And it piqued my interest in exploring other Four Sisters hotels.

Dear Team,  I am sorry to write only now but better late than never... I am a Belgian living in Paris and I visited California for holiday in ocotber. I want to thank you for my wonderful stay with a friend of mine at your property. We had a beautiful kind of appartement. There was no view on the beach as we were at the back but the hotel is walking disatnce from the beach and we have enjoyed sunset every evening.   The hotel is very cute, well decorated and furbished. I love the bathrooms they are amazing!!! front desk staff was very friendly with us, so please thank them. Housekeeping staff was very nice too and did a great job!   The hotel is close to some nice little restaurants were you can have great fish taco's, it is close to the promenade and nice little shops... We

20 or so years ago we lived a few doors down from this hotel, which is located at the north end of the pier parking lot, so knew we were in for a treat. The boardwalk (actually a concrete path passing between the beach and houses for a couple of miles along the peninsula) that everyone bikes, jogs, skates and walks is right in front of this hotel; it is the place you want to be; you step out the front door and you are on the path to a great time. The hotel provides complementary cruiser bikes, which are perfect for the flat Newport Beach peninsula landscape.  There are tons of great restaurants and iconic drinking establishments within walking distance of this hotel (a great seafood place is right next door), and even more within easy reach of the cruiser bikes. We recommend

Great BandB best location in Newport Beach     Free Bike Rentals continental breakfast good location to see the best of Newport  comfortable quiet rooms  Walk to the Sand oceanfront 21 restaurant and Ilfornos great restaurants mutt Lynch Bar and restaurant close by Ride your bike to Balboa Island

We stayed one night and had a room with a partial view. It was great. The view was of the ocean so in the morning we saw the sunrise and also were able to watch the surfers. Everyone one that worked at the hotel was friendly. The room was very nice, clean, well maintained. We would stay here again. Very convenient to walk to nice restaurants also.

We took advantage of a 2 nights for the price of 1 offer after Christmas but regretted that it was only good for the smallest of the rooms.  Had we remained in that room we might not have enjoyed our stay.  Lucky for us the heat wasn't working and we were upgraded to a much larger room for the same deal.  We really appreciated that the staff gave us that option.  But the staff in general was terrific and  made us feel very welcome.  Sunsets from the 2nd floor lounge were a big treat.  Breakfast is "continental" but with yogurt, oatmeal and hard boiled eggs it was plentiful and provided ample choice.  We had thought to come back with friends but the stairs were a bit tough for us (ages 66 and 72) and the steps down to the bathroom were also a bit tricky.  So be sure that the room

Summary Heading: Still a wonderful hotel, but... a new development
Summary: The hotel itself is WONDERFUL and the staff is great. Be aware though, that if you stay in one of the 2 most coveted beachfront rooms you will hear all the after-hours drunken loud mouths piling out of the new restaurant directly below room 101. Even with the window closed (which is disappointing).  I don't know if it's even in the hotel's control. Just a point to consider.   The same thing happens down the sidewalk at the Doryman's Inn anyway, with Sharkey's and the Oceanfront 21 restaurant.

I fell in love with this darling boutique hotel. Reminiscent of a Cape Cod cottage it has so much charm. Decorated for Christmas it was even more beautiful. It has no pool or fancy amenities but what it does have is location! Right on the beach. You can watch the surfers. Nestled in amongst surfer shops, local restaurants and bars there is little evidence of tourism. A wonderful breakfast includes bagels, muffins, hot and cold cereal, cheese and yogurt. There is a bar where you can order beer and wine. There are books and games in the lobby where you can sit and watch the water. Only 17 rooms makes for minimal noise and traffic. Free beach chairs, boogie boards, bikes for guests to use. The staff was wonderful. Don't even think of staying anywhere else!

Picked this hotel because of location and was not disappointed. Easy to walk to restaurants and bars. We stayed in the upper level Junior Suite which was completely remodeled and felt like an apartment. The staff was super nice upon check-in. Marcie explained the parking ($18 day) and showed us how to navigate the alley and back door of the hotel. We brought our own bikes b/c although the hotel had bikes for guest, the rental was only for 2 hrs. Marcie showed us the hotel storage area were we could put our bikes for security at night.  Our room was behind the main building but had a small ocean view (the rooms on the boardwalk have the full ocean views). Full size oven and fridge plus stocked dishes and glassware. Also the suite came stocked with beach chairs, umbrella and beach

Summary Heading: Best buy; great location near restaurants, beach, and estuary.
Summary: Best buy; great location near restaurants (Eat Chow is or favorite for breakfast), beach (comfortable temperatures, enjoy swimming and body surfing, and estuary (perfect for bird watchers.)  Nine char.

Called to book a room with ocean view.  Don't them I haven't been to the ocean in 3 years and was looking forward to swimming and going to beach. They were very excited to take my $400 a night reservation.  We arrived to a "red tide" ocean.  They told me that they never know when it is going to be "red tide" BUT I found out from restaurant owners that it is always "RED TIDE" so BEWARE.  Do not stay at this hotel.  It was not worth it and the hot tub was not running either.  Will never go back!!!  So disappointed that they didn't have the courtesy to tell me it was red time.

Summary Heading: Boutique hotel virtually on the beach with lovely views.
Summary: This is the only ocean side hotel in central Newport beach. Walking distance to restaurants and attractions and a nice boardwalk. Essential to reserve a parking space during high season and weekends. Highly recommended and would return

Summary Heading: The best place in Newport Beach
Summary: This hotel is all you need to know about Newport Beach. The location is perfect, the staff is excellent and the amenities are great. Bicycles, boogie boards, beach chairs and towels. What more do you need? We have stayed here three times, and will be going again in the spring.

I loved loved loved this place. I'll start with two tiny negatives: except for good coffee, the breakfast is really kind of lousy--but better than nothing. And, my room sort of had half a window--so splurge on a better room. I'd stay again anyway, even in that room. The hotel has a sun-washed feel. It is right on the pier, with an open front for people-watching. The staff could not have been more personable and helpful. And the amenities! For no extra cost, you get sand chairs, an umbrella, beach towels and a boogie board, and you can use the bicycles. It's a real value. The bed was comfortable, the pillows not so much, but not awful. I'd stay here again in a second.

We stayed 2 nights in September The location is perfect - situated with a car park out front right on the beach and with bars and restaurants along the boardwalk The hotel is very pretty with some rooms in the main building Our room was 116 behind the main building. Decorated in a very pretty nautical theme with a day bed in the bedroom, desk and tv The bathroom has a feature spa tub and shower with large vanity unit.  No views in these rooms. Two rooms in the main hotel have sea views.  Breakfast was the worst on our trip which was a massive surprise as we'd stayed in the sister hotel Channel Road Inn and it was outstanding.  I lady receptionist was pleasant the other not so.  The hotel has bikes and beach equipment to use which is great.  Free wifi Parking is charged Newport

We used to live in the area and every time we make it back we stay here. The location is the best and the rooms are perfect. We love it here always and forever and we always look forward to our next trip back.

Summary Heading: Great beach front get away for relaxing vacation
Summary: Marvelous location, just steps from the beach.  Exceptionally clean, personable and proficient staff.  We needed a place to relax and rest where we didn't have to drive to eat, etc.  Stayed eleven nights and only took the car out twice to go to nearby attractions

My husband, my son, my daughter, 3 granddaughters, 1 grandson and I all stayed in the two 1-bedroom cottages.  What a fun time!  We made breakfast every morning, walked the beach and the pier during the morning and early afternoon hours, went to Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza mid-afternoon, then back to the hotel.  We walked to dinner to Rockin' Baja Lobster one night, Il Farro Italian Restaurant another and the Crab Cooker another night.  Everyone was so nice and friendly!  Couldn't have had it any better.

The best thing about this hotel is location, you're practically right on the beach and can walk to a ton of different bars and restaurants. Interesting rooms, our room had one king bed and a twin bed with a trundle bed pull out, more ideal I guess for a couple with small children but luckily my brother didn't mind sleeping on the twin. Overall I thought the room was nice, still overpriced but you're paying for location here which is key. My only real negative comment is that they are currently doing work which was never mentioned and I was awoken to drilling outside our room fairly early in the morning-construction seems to follow me these days!

We stayed in the hotel for five nights. We had a great stay. The beds are super comfortable.  The convenience of the location to the beach, restaurants, and the bike path is awesome. We would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with a perfect location and friendly people
Summary: This hotel is right on the beach. It's a great location! The staff here was amazing. They were super friendly and accommodating. Loved the "extras" such as free chair/towel/bike rentals, etc. The small windows in some of the rooms is the only downfall, but all you have to do is walk out your door and you're right on the beach. I would definitely stay here again!

I stayed there from 13-16th July 15. Great location...but the front staff do not provide the service that you'd expect for the price you pay for this property. No one gave me directions of where my room was, and it was only after i'd carried my luggage up 2 flights of stairs that someone came and told me that my room was actually behind an alleyway (which i would never have found myself).  The breakfast is absolutely woeful. Everything and I mean EVERYTHING is pre-packaged (included hard boiled eggs). They have a toaster but no bread...instead an selection of individually packaged pastries. The plates, bowls, cups, cutlery - are all disposable. For the price this property charges, would like to atleast have real cutlery and crockery rather than eating cereal from a plastic

Steps from the beach and right in the heart of Newport beach.  Hotel parking was a lifesaver (NOT INCLUDED!) worth the $18 however since public parking is a nightmare.  Some of the other patrons of the hotel were quite loud at night and the bars on the boardwalk nearby produced quite a bit of noise.  The rooms were nice, a little lacking on the housekeeping and odd layout (pierpoint suite) Price was high also.  We will probably look around for our next trip.

Summary Heading: Great property by the beach and great people
Summary: We had a great stay at this property. Christina, the manager, was amazing. We traveled with a 6 week old baby and she more than helpful to make our stay extremely comfortable. Great people, great location, great property.  Rooms with fireplaces are very beautiful and comfortable, spacious with good vibe. Also, the suits are fantastic as well: nicely decorated with fully equipped kitchen.In the suits, they have separate bedroom and very nice kitchen-living area. (During our stay we happen to experience both - thank you to Christina, the manager)

This was our second stay. We upgraded to one of the new cottages at the rear of the property which gave us a full kitchen and a nice large living room area to enjoy. The remodeling of the space was done very well. Beautiful granite counters and lovely shower and bath. The one tiny closet in the bedroom was a challenge. It was smaller than the closet in a standard hotel and if you brought 4 to share the cottage, it would be an issue. That said, the place was just lovely and clean and comfortable. And the beach is right out the door! Charming beach getaway spot with lots to do within an easy walk. This is our go to spot in southern California.

Summary Heading: A Wonderful Two Nights On The Beach
Summary: The Newport Beach Hotel building was initially constructed in 1905 and maintains much of its original charm. There are about 20 rooms in this hotel, and they vary greatly in available amenities, size and views. Upgrades to the guest rooms and lobby have been made and they reflect a California beach ambience.  From the hotel entrance to the sand is about 150’. Shops, very good restaurants, the pier, and dory fleet are all within about 4 blocks from the hotel.  The wife and I recently spent two nights at the Newport Beach Hotel in one of their two ocean front rooms.  Simply put, the 2nd floor room was great and view was magnificent.  The room itself had a raised spa bath in the bathroom.  The bed was comfortable and two chairs by the window were provided.  Our room had a great TV,

Summary Heading: Good location and nice clean rooms
Summary: This is a very nice hotel close to the beach. The rooms are very clean. The staff is very polite and friendly at all times. The hotel has a very completed style, that fits with the location close to the beach. The WIFI at the hotel does almost not work at all, especially in the hotel rooms. A very good hotel to stay in if you like to be close to the beach and nice restaurants.

Summary Heading: Great location, right off the boardwalk
Summary: Rent a bike and hunker down here. Short walk to restaurants and shopping. The price was right when we went, and we found it to be cozy and clean. The beach is literally right out the front door, and the beach is phenomenal.

Beautiful room over looking ocean. Really nice jetted tub. King bed. Great customer service. Next door to excellent fish house. Happy hour starts at 3. Also, they serve continental breakfast from 6AM till 10AM. Will definitely return to this lovely place. No elevators if you need them, sorry.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay right on the beach.
Summary: We found this inn to be very pleasant and well located, a little pricey but to be expected for the area.  My husband had to be in Anaheim for business and we chose Newport Beach as our 'home' location for the business trip and we're so glad we did!  We had no trouble with traffic traveling back and forth.  The Inn was charming and well located across from the beach.  We also went down to Laguna beach for dinner and to enjoy sunset.  An easy drive from here.  We are surfing fans so we got up early in the morning, rode bikes (provided by the hotel) and watched the guys riding The Wedge.  We even spent a day at Disneyland and found it an easy commute back to the hotel, no traffic at all that late!  The rooms are pleasant.  They have wood floors (which makes it feel cleaner) unusual

If you're an active, inquisitive foodie, you'll adore this hotel. Adorable beach bicycles are supplied and the bike trail right outside the front door is a feast for the eyes: the Pacific Ocean, the eclectic architecture of the beachside cottages, and the quaint shops. My husband and I didn't want to leave!!!

We were disappointed in this Four Sisters property. It was over-priced for the small room, parking space and lacked amenities as a Four Sisters property. It is beachfront, clean and within walking distance to a few shops or restaurants, however, we chose this hotel after staying at the Blue Lantern Inn. We expected similar quality and amenities such as complimentary afternoon cookies or snacks, and a delicious breakfast. We were disappointed in the continental breakfast which consisted of packaged foods including boiled eggs, toast, muffins, cheese and cereal. We were willing to pay the higher price for the beachfront room because we expected one comparable to the Blue Lantern.

Small BnB type hotel. Steps from the beach.  Comfortable and great staff.  Few rooms have very small windows close  adjacent building.  Other rooms have great beach views. Ask for rooms in the back as well. Super light with partial ocean views. Nice breakfast area in lobby and close to restaurants etc.

This was our first time visiting Newport Beach and this hotel could not have been more perfect. Right on the beach the location is great. Private parking in the back. We were given a room right at the front of the property facing the beach where you can sit and watch the sunset from the big bay windows. The jacuzzi bath in the bathroom was amazing and the bed was brilliant. Also they give you free bicycles to cycle right along Newport Beach definitely one of the highlights of our trip.

My girlfriend and I met here for a "girls getaway" where we could park the car, forget about it, and enjoy catching up since we live in different states. We had a lovely time at this hotel! The parking lot I have to say is VERY SMALL (like 10 spaces?) but I don't think that's a problem because they don't have a lot of rooms. But the spaces are squeezed too. So don't expect to get anything larger than a small sized SUV in there. (We were driving a prius so we were fine). This isn't a detractor to the hotel though, it's just a fact. And big SUVs are probably used to these problems anyways. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The room was clean and I loved the skylight in the shower with all glass doors. We did not partake in any amenities like food or bar in the lobby, but

This boutique hotel is located right on the beach (one of only two in Newport Beach). Lobby and 2d Floor windows open for sea breezes. Wi-Fi , bicycles, beach chairs, newsapers, breakfast and coffee are included. Parking is extra, but worth it in this busy town. Raucous bars and restaurants are near, but the hotel was quiet at night. An easy walk to good restaurants and clubs. They don't nickel and dime you!  A real gem.

We stayed 3 days over the holiday weekend.I made the reservation all the way back in September for room 101. King size bed and ocean view. We loved to be able to sit and look out at the ocean and people watch. The window there are very unusual and gave you the feeling of being right on the beach. The location is perfect. Lots to do. And when the party from the bars down stairs gets too loud , just shut the windows and the noise almost disappears. The jacuzzi tub/shower was a nice addition. Stepping up and then down into the tub was a bit challenging but well worth it. Another plus was having the option to pay for parking and knowing that there was going to be a spot for you. Getting thru the parking lot out front takes patience, but the end result is worth it all.

This little hotel is a real jem on the Newport coast. The rooms are nice and comfortable, the location, right in the beach, is perfect to really enjoy what California has to offer.  Free towels, beach chairs and games are available at the reception to rent.  Breakfast is not great but enough to start the day.  Really really suggested.

Newport  Beach Hotel is the perfect location on the beach, bikes available, great restaurants within walking distance. The quiet peaceful setting is so relaxing and who doesn't love gorgeous sunsets at the beach! Great service and amenities!!

I had never been to Newport and decided to book the weekend at Newport Beach Hotel for a romantic getaway with my boyfriend (and his 40th birthday ;) ). I was SO impressed with the location! We woke up in the morning to a breathtaking view of the ocean (we had arrived late at night so we didn't see how incredible the location was) and decided to take a walk down the beach. I was delighted to see the little fish market near the pier (neither of us had ever experienced anything like it)! The hotel was so cute and quaint, we felt right at home. The jetted tub with the skylight was a HUGE bonus ;)

This hotel is at the Newport Pier, adjacent to Mutt Lynches.  The rooms are small, but very well appointed and you do not feel like you are staying in a small room.  There are several areas withing the hotel to relax as well as the beach steps from the door.  They have bicycles, beach chairs, and towels for guests to use.  The bicycles are great to explore the penninsula everywhere from the wedge to Pacific Coast Hwy down balboa blvd.  Restaurants are within walking distance, never used my car the two nights I stayed there.  They have a continental breakfast or you can go to many of the restaurants nearby to eat.  When I am back in Newport Beach, I will definintely stay here again.  Avoid the Beach Ball bar the bartenders are extremely rude.  Blackies and Mutt Lynches are great

Summary Heading: Clean, cozy, and on the beach
Summary: We stayed here one night before all the Thanksgiving day festivities at the in laws house in Arcadia, CA. Kind of a relaxation before the storm!. I was very impressed on the location of the hotel, it is right on the beach, well, the strand actually, but has a great view of the ocean and the pier. The staff was amazing, Dianne at the front desk was fantastic and was always in a good mood. There are a number of dining choices within walking distance, we chose the place next door that was more like a sports bar which we really enjoyed. The hotel has complimentary bikes and beach chairs to use, we didn't have time to use them but it was nice to know they were available. Parking costs $18 which is in a secure lot behind the hotel. The lot out front is metered so unless you want to

We found this place by chance. It is right on the beach front and has a free locked car park. It doesn't look much from the outside but the rooms are lovely. Large and attractive with hard wood floors and huge showers with jacuZzi bath function. Lovely white furniture and comfy beds. Reception staff are brilliant and the hotel lends out beach towels, umbrellas, toys, chairs and even bikes for free. Breakfast is great. Cereals, muffins (good!), bagels etc etc. Good coffee making facility in room, ironing board, proper hair dryer and there is a small bar at the hotel that sells beer, wine and soft drinks. So glad we found this and a real cut above a motel for not much more money. Great restaurants literally next door and the balboa peninsula is great. Gorgeous beach.

The hotel was newly remodeled and in great condition. The location is perfect, right on the beach. The staff was helpful and courteous.  Breakfast was better than expected. They offer beach chairs and toys for the kids. Would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: We loved the Newport Beach Hotel
