Summary: My wife and I recently spent two wonderful nights at the Newport Beach Hotel.  The location is perfect for quick access to the beach, restaurants and all that is fun in Newport Beach.  The staff was very friendly and informative.  Everyone was so nice.  My wife and I have found our getaway spot at the lovely Newport Beach Hotel!!

We stayed 3 nights this past weekend. The room was over $500 per night (including $18 daily parking) and was billed as 'ocean view', so when I checked the place out on Google Earth, I figured for sure we'd be in the room right at the front of the hotel, 2nd floor, just above reception. Not so, we weren't even in the front building. We were actually 2 buildings and a parking lot from the beach. We COULD see the beach from our room, or at least a sliver of it between two buildings, so technically it was 'ocean view' but we were tremendously disappointed and felt misled. It should have been billed as 'partial ocean view' or even 'limited'. I'd have never laid out that kind of dough for a room had I been aware of the true facts. I have to say, the young lady at check in was very
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback. I am so pleased that you enjoyed the location of the hotel, the comfort  of our brand new Sailor Suite and the service you received from the staff. I sincerely apologize, however, that you were disappointed with the views from your guestroom. Although not the ocean front guestroom, that has views over the boardwalk and parking, that you were envisioning, we feel the full view of the beach and ocean from the living room, surely deserves the description “ocean view”.   May I take this opportunity to apologize for not clearly labeling the dispenser in the bathroom. In our continuous efforts to be a green establishment, we limit our use of the disposable plastic bottles, as much as we can, to just lotion and conditioner, as they can cause issues with the dispenser. We feel using shampoo only in the dispenser is one small way to reduce our waste. Again, I am so sorry this was not more clearly marked and I will certainly be addressing the issue.    Please know that we try our utmost to exceed our guests expectations in every way so I am so sorry that you were also disappointed with our continental style breakfast, the television remote control and the on-site parking. I very much hope that we have the opportunity to earn back your trust and would happily make myself available to discuss the best guestroom for your needs, should you choose to visit with us again.   Warmly Kristina DeLorme Manager

Summary: I brought my grandkids down for a long weekend in Sept. and we loved it.  The people  were hospitable at the hotel, and very helpful. Several restaurants, shopping, and love riding bikes on the boardwalk. Thank you for a wonderful weekend! See you next year! Lynn Randino

we stayed here last night to celebrate my husband's birthday with our son who lives nearby.  First of all when I made the reservation, I was told that the room was $165 per night plus $18 parking. Upon checkout we were charged $265 including taxes and parking. I never looked at my confirmation email which did say the room was $225 per night so didn't try to fight it.   First of all, the hotel is not on the beach. It's across a parking lot from the beach.  The rooms are tiny and there is a problem with the showers. Inconsistent temperatures and low water pressure. We have stayed at several Four Sisters inns in CA and always find them charming and a good value. Not the case in Newport.   There is no afternoon wine and cheese and the continental breakfast is packaged pastries, corn

Cute hotel-clean well kept.  Continental breakfast was great, food was fresh and cold stuff was cold.  Al of the people were nice, location couldn't be better, right on the beach.  It was awesome.    Parking is extra and very tight fit.  Drive a small car if you can.

Summary Heading: Quaint and right on the beach
Summary: The room was quaint.  If you are a large person, using the bathroom in the room with any privacy might prove difficult as the door swings in and you literally have to squeeze out of the way to close the door.  the only mirror in the room is over the sink, which is a cool sink, but doesn't allow for anything else to be near it. (like a curling iron or hair dryer)  The bathtub us HUGE, you could fit two grown people in it with room to spare, but the placement of the shower head makes it so you have to get right against the edge to shower.  the hot water was intermittent and took a bit to arrive, so don't jump in and turn on the water expecting a hot shower.  the room was a decent size.  The only way to the rooms is up a flight of stairs, so if you can't lug the suitcase up, you

Summary Heading: Nice seaside hotel with tiny rooms
Summary: If you need a hotel on the beach and don't plan to spend much time in your room; this hotel would be fine.  BUT the room we had was tiny wiith barely enough room for us, our cases and the bed.  The bathroom though was huge.  The room WAS comfortably furnished but overall we felt very confined and were glad we were only there one night.The coffee and fruity iced water in reception were a nice touch.

My husband and I spent the weekend at the Newport Beach Hotel and it was wonderful.  The rooms are small but clean and lovely.  This small Inn is right on the beach in the middle of Newport so you can walk or bike to everything.  They provide bikes, beach chairs, towels, umbrellas and a light breakfast all included and with a smile.  The interior has a lovely lobby where you can sit with your coffee or drink and gaze at the ocean or read the newspaper.  All the rooms are on the second floor and when you come out of your room, you look down the hall to the most beautiful view of the ocean.  Our room had a small window and we could see the ocean as well, but if you really want a view, select the large rooms in the front.  There are very few hotels on the beach and we were so

I am so glad I selected this hotel over the two I had considered in Laguna Beach and Hermosa.   This was the perfect place for a fun and romantic one night getaway to get a good taste of the Southern California lifestyle.   The manager couldn't have been nicer, nor more accommodating.  Our room was lovely - one of two oceanfront rooms in this little boutique hotel.  We felt like we were walking into a Pottery Barn show room.  Loved the jacuzzi tub for two that overlooks the ocean.  The bed was comfortable.  We also loved having a ceiling fan and the option to open the windows and enjoy the waves crashing and the option to shut the windows and turn on the a/c if needed if the boardwalk got noisy later in the evening.   We look forward to coming back here....the perfect place to

You can't beat the location, right on the strip looking out on to the beach. You watch the other beach goers fighting for parking in front of the hotel while you have a secured spot in the back. It doesn't get more convenient for location. It is a very popular part of the strip with several bars nearby and downstairs. I was pleasantly surprised that I did not hear the bar at all from my room.  Our room was quaint, clean and small. You are really paying for the location. It is an older hotel that has been remodeled and has more of a bed and breakfast feel.  The staff was very friendly. We arrived before check in and were allowed to park our car in the hotel lot early until our room was ready which was very helpful because parking is a nightmare there. I was a little bummed that

Our little couple's retreat to this hotel was excellent. Both Marci and Kylie were great employees and helpful with questions. All the accouterments were spot on. Only suggestion is comp breakfast was sufficient but could have provided a little more options. The hotel is little and quaint and quite lovely. I would recommend to others.

We booked our hotel 2 months before our stay. Me and my boyfriend are 18 and we called ahead and they told us it was 18+ to rent a room. We live 1000 miles away and flew here for a relaxing vacation. We go to check in and they say we can't stay there because it's 21+. So we had to spend hours scrambling to find another hotel. They told us we could stay there and then we get there after a full day of travel and they wouldn't let us stay. Ridiculous. They wouldn't fix it for us even though it was their mistake. Terrible.

Beautiful hotel steps from the beach.  The staff are so friendly and helpful.  The rooms have a wow factor but our room could have benefitted from a heavier curtain as daylight poured in at 5am.  Breakfast was complimentary as was the Wifi.  The hotel has a secure parking lot to the rear.  I have christened this hotel my mini shutters on the beach and I have great memories of my visit to Newport Beach as a result of my stay.

This was a great find of a hotel located in the heart of Newport Beach.  The staff was friendly and let us use their bikes for free to explore all Newport has to offer including Balboa Island. The rooms were well appointed and a little quirky but overal nice and clean.  The hotel is located steps from the beach and walking distance to all the bars and stores.   Very good value, can't wait to come back.

Summary Heading: Needs some attention to be 4 or 5 star.
Summary: I can see that this used to be quite the boutique inn..... It needs some serious attention though, as it is starting to slip. There were multiple repairs needed in our jacuzzi suite which, if it were my inn and I wanted to be a 4 or 5 star, I'd take care of those ASAP. The phone didn't work in our room (or the whole inn, as we found out). There are pieces of drywall chunked out of the wall, tiles missing in the bathroom, pieces of floor trim torn partially up.   Other notes: parking is not free, it is $18/ night. Breakfast is less than a holiday inn express.... Muffin or bagel in Saran Wrap, coffee, cereal or hard booked eggs, no decaf coffee and condiments like jam not stocked up. Garbage in breakfast room not emptied all day, so at night full of breakfast things, and the

Summary Heading: Home style, cute hotel right on the water at Newport Beach
Summary: This hotel is fantastic if you are looking for a family vibe hotel. The staff are really lovely and they all really want you to enjoy your stay. They provide complimentary parking and continental breakfast daily. This place is really clean, tidy and well appointed. Everything in our room was clean and suited us to a tee. We stayed in room 108 and it had a spa in the room. They have free bike hire which we utilised and went for a bike ride up to Huntington Beach.

We actually stayed here in August 2012 but it won't let me go that far back - been meaning to write a review ever since!  We had two nights here during out honeymoon and it truly fabulous!!  The staff were so friendly, supplied us with bikes, games and towels for the beach free of charge!  The room was clean, quiet and over all great and the location well this is to die for - right on the beach!   Newport Beach is a beautiful place to stay and I can't recommend this hotel enough, hope to return one day!

My wife and I stayed here in Mar / 14. We arrived way before check-in and was given an upgraded room without asking by the wonderful hotel manager.While it did not have an ocean view, it was not needed as there is a beautiful sitting area on the upper front floor, which we used each morning and evening. The room was clean, spacious and quiet.The continental breakfast was perfect, All the staff were super friendly. The hotel is situated in the heart of Newport, so you you want to experience some awesome beach life, then this the the place.

Well, as many of you know from previous reviews, I am a big fan of Hermosa Beach and go quite often. This year my kids and I decided to change it up and head to Newport Beach for spring break. I had come across a small, elegant, boutique hotel called The Newport Beach Hotel. It was a bit like stumbling across a secret garden. Nestled in an otherwies over populated tourist pier is one of the most precious hotels in California. The staff is like that friendly neighbor you love seeing when you were a kid. They are kind, accomodating and always seeking to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are warm, tasteful and beautifully decorated and are incredibly quiet considering the size of the hotel. There is something for everyone from newlyweds, who we met on our first night, to families

I met my daughter in Southern California so we could spend a few days together before she had to return to graduate school. Because we were on a budget, we picked hotels based on cost, and we had stayed at a Laguna beach hotel the night before for the same price that was disappointing. We expected the same out of this hotel, but we were tickled that wasn't the case. The location was fantastic, the rooms and lobby darling, the staff unbelievably accommodating, and the extras surprising. We took the free bikes to Balboa island on a magical day, rode the free boogie boards in the icy surf, lounged on the free towels, a and felt pampered all day. Great place!

My husband and I stayed here for 1 night. We were visiting Newport to see the Boat Light Parade.  We loved this little place! We splurged for an ocean front room and it was well worth it. the view is amazing. You can sit in the jet tub and watch the sunset. Doesn't get much better than this. Room was very clean, I loved that it was hardwood floors, so much for sanitary than carpet in hotel rooms. The location is nice because you can walk to the pier and there are lots of shops, restaurants, etc within walking distance. We borrowed the beach cruisers (free, included with you room) and rode along the boardwalk. Such a nice added bonus. The Seafood restaurant located right below the hotel is excellent! We can't wait to go back. After staying at the Marriott Newport Coast Villas, we

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was wonderful. We didn't want to leave. We stayed in the ocean front suite and what a view! The room is quaint and very nicely decorated with hardwood floors and a fantastic king bed.  The pictures on their website are very accurate.The open air windows allow you to hear the ocean waves at night. The entire staff was very nice, especially the housekeeper. The only down side to this hotel is the bar located next to it, actually below it. (I am not referring to Mutt Lynch's on the corner. That place is always a party!) This bar looks like a quiet little place to have a nice glass of wine some good food but later into the evening the patrons get a little loud and when you have the windows open in the room to listen to the surf those

Summary Heading: You'll love the sunsets and the relaxing beach/surf vibe"
Summary: When we stepped into our room following a long east to west coast flight and road trip - our reaction was "Wow!" The cool pacific breeze from our large window refreshed us immediately. Although the beach was steps away, we had a front row seat to the most gorgeous sunset ever from the comfy wicker chairs placed by the window.   A unique feature was the luxurious raised tub, strategically placed for privacy but with a glass wall allowing us to relax in the whirlpool while still feeling a part of the beach scene outside. We woke every morning to local surfers enjoying the waves at daybreak near the pier. Our room was clean and spacious, the staff attentive and friendly, the location an easy walk to shopping and restaurants. We loved the Fly n' Fish Oyster Bar located right next

The Newport Beach Hotel is very well located across from the Newport Beach and a public city metered parking lot. Very well situated to watch the stunning sunset on the horizon of the Pacific Ocean from the two upstair front rooms or the first floor centre sitting area. The breakfast included was very nice. It also has a pre-paid gated private hotel parking lot. It could be better if an in-room safe is provided. The beach chair, beach towel, beach toy, beach bike are provided free.

The staff made this one night stay extraordinary.  From check in with Marcie to the housekeeping mother-daughter team to getting to know the adorable Hannah that afternoon (and another evening chat after dinner) made the stay seem like several days.  The lobby is great and everything was very clean.  We will stay there again when back in the vicinity.  Hopefully soon!

This hotel could not be in a better location, you are literally across from the beach with restaurants surrounding you. The hotel staff is wonderful and very friendly. The room was nicely laid out but very small, it was would be tough for 2 people to share. There was also a bug issue in my room that I heard other hotels guests complain about as well so for those reasons I likely would not recommend this hotel.

The staff at the Newport Beach Hotel was exceptional, assistant manager Marcie was very accommodating to our request for an early check in, granted this was after a holiday weekend in September, so traffic was a little light.  We had the Mariner Room, which although was on the small side, the bed was comfortable and the room very nicely decorated with the nautical theme, huge shower and extremely clean.  There is a nice sitting area on the second floor that overlooks the beach and is a great place to have an afternoon bottle of wine taking in the sights.  One of the great benefits of this hotel is the free use of beach cruiser bikes, this is the only way to tour the beach & nearby Balboa Island, this is a must.  It is also great to have free use of beach chairs and towels for

The room is lovely and the people who work there couldn't be nicer. The tricky thing about booking and paying for "beach-front" hotels in California is that just when you think you've considered everything, there's a new obstacle.  There are no buildings between your "ocean-front" room and the actual ocean, but there is a parking lot full of 4 lanes of cars, tons of honking etc.  If the picture in your head is one of serenity and the sounds of waves lapping on the shore, you have a lot to block out here. That said, don't pay extra for the ocean-view and enjoy the bikes, the towels, parking, wine, breakfast and terrifically friendly hosts.

I loved this hotel. The room had a comfortable bed, large spa bath and was beautifully decorated. We were in a room back from the beach and it was very quiet although not a lot of sunlight got in the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I loved the free cruiser bikes you can use. Great to ride up the boardwalk which is right outside the hotel. The wifi was good and you could get it anywhere in the hotel and the breakfast was simple but very nice.

Taking a trip to Newport Beach Hotel was an absolute pleasure.  Staying at the hotel captured the hustle and bustle of people making their trek to the beach...summing up Americana at the beach for the summer.   Our hostess provided us with bikes, locks, towels and boogie boards for our day for fun in the sun.  Tutti Fruitti yogurt is around the corner and plenty of dining within walking distance.  Our hostess was kind and extremely helpful!

My finance and I recently stayed at the hotel at the beginning of July. We had a wonderful visit. We've stayed there twice so far and have enjoyed both trips. The staff and customer service was excellent and very accommodating! Great customer service goes a long way and they provide it. One of the best attributes about this place would be the location. It will literally take you ten seconds to walk to the beach and put your little tootsies into the water. Yeah, that close! It is also next door to the infamous Mutt Lynch's restaurant/bar. They provide all the amenities from beach chairs, towels, umbrellas to boogie boards and beach cruisers to ride up and down the board walk. The rooms are average but very clean. They also provide a continental breakfast in the morning to start

Summary Heading: liebevoll gestaltetes hotel in toller lage/gem on the beach
Summary: this is a very nice little hotel, friendly and helpful staff, great location right on the beach! you can borrow bikes and street chairs for free. also there are a great number of bars and restaurants close by. we only stayed for two nights, but wished we had booked the room for longer.

Once again we visited this wonderful place. Never got in a car either walked everywhere or rode the bike provided by the hotel.  Very relaxed and a friendly staff. Very Clean. And very helpful. Cant wait to got back.

We stayed at the Newport beach Hotel in late June, perhaps the first full weekend of summer, as the beach was crowded and people were mingling and wandering all weekend. The hotel is lovely and the staff could not be more accommodating. We had a comfortable room with a huge glass enclosed jacuzzi tub. We also spent both evenings in the second floor lounge overlooking the ocean. We were offered beach chairs and bikes compliments of the hotel. The continental breakfast was very nice and we could sit and relax in a living room type atmosphere while sipping coffee and reading the daily paper. This is the only hotel we saw on the boardwalk, and the ocean is right there. We also parked behind the hotel which was tight, but convenient as parking was at a premium on the weekend. We

This place was much better than I even imagined it would be. From the moment you walk in the door you just feel peaceful. I like that it was a small, boutique style hotel with a warm vibe. Upstairs there is a sitting area with a fantastic view of the ocean. The rooms were decorated very nicely and the décor throughout the entire hotel was beachy and classy. My mom and I didn't want to leave, and we still talk about what a great place it was. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here again in a heart beat.

The smaller rooms represents a good bargain given the location, steps from the beach and the accessibility to bar and restaurant. This is one of those places where you can forget your car for a week and just enjoy the area, visiting the pier, the marina, balboa island on your feet or with the bike.  Hotel staff very helpful, accommodating and discreet.  Recommended get away to relax and enjoy this beach community.

Summary Heading: Wants to be more than it is unfortunately
Summary: Had a 3 day stay at the Newport Beach hotel in June. I wanted to like the Neport Beach hotel but I'm not sure if my objections were more about Newport Beach itself. The hotel does a very good job on pulling off the Beach House vibe, with appointments, fabrics and feel of the property. The nautical theme comes in handy within the room as at least for the standard version because it's about the same size as a cruise ship cabin. It's a tight fit and a bit problematic but overall the beach vibe thing works. We had some issues on cold water only from the sink, TINY bathroom and very very thin walls ... You're gonna hear everything from your neighbors. There's a great restaurant/bar next door Fly N Fish and it had great food, drinks and service. Service at the hotel was generally good

Never even knew this hotel existed! What a great find!  Came here during Memorial Day weekend so the area was extremely busy...thank goodness for secure hotel parking!  The room was very clean and cozy.  The hotel staff Hannah and her sister very hospitable.  Walking  distance to all the restaurants and beach.  would love to come stay again during the off season!

My sister and I stay here at least twice a year and have been coming here for several years. This Hotel is like home away from home. Great breakfast, nice glass of wine in the afternoon, take bikes out for a ride or chairs to just sit on the beach and read a book. The rooms are very inviting, clean and plenty of room for the two of us.We spend the extra $$  to park in the safely gated parking lot. The staff is always available and go out of their way to make sure we have what we need. There are great restaurants, shops and several bars. WE LOVE THIS HOTEL. We'll be back in October and can't wait.

My (almost) wife and I stayed here two years ago and have recently looked into staying he again.  We had a room at the back of the hotel and loved it.  We have stayed at a number of five star hotels and while this is not a five star hotel it is truly a wonderful place.  The first thing we noticed was how clean our room was.  It smelled amazing when we walked into the room.  We truly appreciated this about the hotel.  It is right on the beach and I remember tracking in sand, which is impossible not to do.  The next day after going out for breakfast the sand was gone and the room was spotless.  It is little things like this that we appreciate.  Our room was great size with a hot tub and the colors and sky lights made for a great relaxing California beach room we would expect.  We

Great service, beautiful rooms, roomy bathtubs for two, coffee all day, bikes, beach gear, surf spot right in front. What more could you ask for? There are even some great dive bars nearby!! Eat at the new Fly n Fish, or have a beer at Mutt Lynch's. This hotel is within walking distance of everything.   We love it and have stayed there 5 times in the last two years. You can't go wrong.

We have been staying here for several years, since it was the original Portofino Hotel. We've reviewed this hotel before, but as time passes, little things go up and down in consistency. They don't inform you ahead of time of construction, and when you are caught by surprise they make no concessions in the name of acknowledging loyal customers. The parking lot is nicely protected, but it's nerve wrackingly tight if you have a nice car. Nice touches like in room snack offerings come and go. This time they weren't there.  All in all though, you can't beat sitting in front of the window reading a book and enjoying the breeze. The front 2 rooms are really the only ones worth getting, but in the morning all the wannabe corporate execs congregate outside your door in the common area

This is the second time we have stayed at the Newport Beach Hotel, and we love it!! We checked in and were informed that there was remodeling taking place between the hours of 8-5. This was not an issue for us; the noise was very minimal and the manager did her best to put us in a room as far away as possible. As a matter of a fact, she upgraded us to an oceanfront room! The cleanliness and fantastic customer service made our stay perfect. The location is perfect for us..we love to have everything (including bars and nightlife) within walking distance. Thanks again for the wonderful stay, we will definitely be back!

At the last minute, we decided to stay here. Wow...we are soooo glad we did!  The rooms are clean, the location is perfect, and the staff was very friendly!  They had bikes for us to borrow so we had a blast on the boardwalk. We would highly recommend staying here.

My wife and I enjoyed Spring Break '13 in Newport Beach, CA. We stayed at the Newport Beach Hotel (NBH). The NBH is located on the boardwalk across from the beach. It's adjacent to restaurants and bars, shopping and business services. You couldn't ask for a better or more convenient location. The NBH has fifteen guest rooms on the second floor. There's a relaxing sitting area on the second floor with a window that opens overlooking the boardwalk and beach. A small indoor fountain anchors the other end of the large hallway. There are several sitting areas on the first floor. A small wine bar is available for hotel guests. We enjoyed fine wine and were warmed by the gas fireplace that provides a delightful ambiance.   The hospitality of the NBH staff was unparalleled. From the

I wanted to create some R & R for my husband's birthday.  This hotel has two beachfront rooms with peaceful ocean views.  We went there to rest and get some peace.  However, we were not informed of the construction which meant tarps, drills and hammers.  The only thing worse was the Manager's lack of charm.  When I called to inquire about the early morning barrage of noise, she replied, "they start at 8 am."  I continued to explain that it was too early and then she said she'd speak to workers.  After being so abruptly woken, our schedule was thrown off.  So, I asked if we could extend our checkout by some minutes.  She gave an emphatic "no" even though checkout is at 11 and there were four hours before the next person could check in.  I complained to the main office and they

I've stayed many times at Newport Beach Hotel. It is for business purposes mostly, so at the end of the day it feels like a mini vacation, not the generic corporate hotel chains that I usually stay at. Great location, very friendly staff and management, many places to eat, and right on beach. Great for watching the sun melt away over the Pacific. If going to California, you want to stay right by the water, I would recommend trying here

We stayed for three nights total in the oceanfront spa room. The room is quiet small for the price, granted the view from the room is nice over looking the beach parking lot, then to the ocean. The room sits over a bar, so if your looking for a quiet restful place to relax and enjoy the ocean, this is not the place to stay. It was noisy all three nights with people yelling, honking horns until 2:30 in the morning. The website does mention it as a "youthful energy including an eclectic beach scene" not really mentioning the bar noise that is just below you most of the night.  The room isn't all that clean, the fans were dusty, the trim railing was covered with a least an 1/8" of dust. The spa tub is like being in a fish bowl open to the parking lot below. There are traces of

Summary Heading: Newport Beach - wonderful location, lovely place
Summary: I stayed at this property a decade ago when it was the Portofino Beach Hotel.  Always wanted to return.  Finally was able to.  Same setting, lovely rooms, extremely accommodating, helpful and friendly staff.  Due to very early flight was unable to take breakfast so no review there.  For the Newport Beach Hotel, location is everything.  If looking for great room-views of the ocean; there's only two rooms with this view.  HOWEVER, each room is unique, well-appointed, beds very comfortable.   Only negative change is addition of a parking fee ($18/night) which seemed steep - although near-waterfront property in NPB has got to be expensive as heck to keep undeveloped as a parking lot!

I stayed in Room 114 which is near the back of property. My room was wonderful, clean, and plenty of space. Although there was a fireplace and air conditioner, I never used them. I did enjoy the huge soaking tub in the bathroom. The manager is friendly and keeps familiar with her guests. Good choices available at breakfast (provided daily). Plenty of sitting/conversation areas in the tastefully appointed common areas. I am looking forward to a return visit and would highly recommend this quaint hotel to anyone staying in Newport Beach

This is our second Four Sisters location and we have been very pleased with both of our stays so far. Newport  Beach Hotel is an updated Inn that is cenrally located adjacent to the beach. Our room was a bit small, but clean and well appointed. The breakfast buffet is continental and has a good selection. The lobby area is very warm and welcoming and the upstairs sitting area features a spectacular view of the beach and ocean. Next door is a fun, no reservation restaurant that features fresh food and excellent service. The front two rooms feature views and higher rates, rooms to the back have limited or no views, but who wants to be inside when you are in Newport Beach?

We stayed here while I took an art workshop in Newport. The staff here is very friendly and helpful--they get 5 stars!  The rooms are nice, but feel cold in the winter because of the all wood floors.  I'm sure this would be fine in the summer.  We stayed in the ocean front room, which has great views of the surfers who frequent this spot.  I think it could be quite noisy in the summer as these rooms are right above the parking lot.  We got the reduced winter rate, so felt the hotel was a good value.  The continental breakfast was so-so, the coffee very good.  Note that parking in the gated lot is an additional $18 per night.  We parked in the public lot in front because we were there after 6:00 pm and left by 8:00 am in the morning (they are metered at other times).  This was

This is a boutique hotel across a parking lot from the beach.  There are only two rooms that front the beach and they charge a premium for these rooms.  The other rooms in the main building are small but the rooms in the back annex are larger.  Pros: Location, continental breakfast, fireplace and jetted tub in the room (not sure about every room), friendly staff, beach theme, cute lobby, free use of bikes and beach chairs.  Cons: Well let's start by saying that this place is an older property and they could pay closer attention to some problems.  The toilet in our room would run off-and-on which will keep you awake if you don't shut off the water.  We told the staff but it was not fixed.  Wi-fi in the room was sporadic.  There was a desk but no electrical outlet.  This was the

Summary Heading: Nothing bugged us about this fantastic inn!
Summary: Spent a lovely night here in an oceanfront room.  A+++ on cleanliness, comfort, view, location, friendliness of staff, and just overall beachiness.  This will be a favorite for our get away mid week trips.  Loved it!

Summary Heading: Something bugged us about this property...
Summary: We celebrated our anniversary here, taking advantage of a Travelzoo offer. Was a bit ambivalent because of some of the other reviews. But the location was ideal because we could easily walk or bike to the harbor cruise we were gonna take that evening that served unlimited drinks. We actually were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Felt homey like a bed-and-breakfast. We knew were getting a room without a window, but it was decorated beautifully, and quite serene, with an enticing big white bed with puffy bedding! The lobby area was beautiful too, and given it was a Sunday, we had the run of the house. Sat by the front open windows and enjoyed our complimentary wine (part of the deal). Beautiful sunny day! The host was lovely, too. Assisted us when we couldn't find where to park,

Where to began...best location, cozy home feeling room with a perfect ocean view, spacious tub with jets and taking showers in the natural light freedom. The staff was super friendly and help at suggestion great places to eat and have fun. They provided u with everything u need to enjoy the beach at no extra cost: beach towels, umbrellas, chairs, and beach cruisers

My husband and I stayed here for a romantic weekend away. We stayed in one of the rooms towards the back end of the hotel for the first 2 nights. It was a large room with a fireplace, over-sized tub and lots of natural light. We were very comfortable there and had peace, quiet and privacy. For our last night we decided to take one of the oceanfront rooms. This room was considerably smaller but we didn't care. The views were to die for and we loved taking baths and showers while watching the beach and sunsets. We enjoyed sitting in the chairs we had in the room overlooking the boardwalk while drinking our cocktails at night and coffee in the morning. All the rooms had very comfortable beds, beach-themed decor in blues and whites and were extremely clean (I am very particular

Perfect getaway vacation!  My daughter and I spent three nights celebrating our birthdays.  We were in room 103 which was great - top of the stairs near the the open windows looking towards the beach.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The location could not have been better.  We enjoyed using the bikes and beach chairs the hotel offered.  We walked everywhere we went with the exception of Fashion Island.  The continental breakfast was usual but there are little markets nearby where you can enhance it.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Location Location Location... But thats not all!
Summary: Sometimes, it's all about location, and this place has it! Steps away from the beach, bike trails, bars and restaurants, this hotel was the perfect place to stay.   The rooms are clean, modern and perfectly decorated for a beach vacation. It's a small hotel and service from the staff was friendly and very helpful. Not every room has a view but we didn't spend our days inside the room anyway.    Complimentary continental breakfast, coffee, bicycles, boogie boards, beach towels, beach chairs etc. added a lot of value and make it worth the price of the room.   We will definitely be returning!!!

Very nice weekend, room - as always - nice and clean, lovely spa and comfortable bed. Staff is friendly. I love the breakfast too. They provide towels and chairs for the beach, just a few steps away. Will return for sure.

Summary Heading: Location, friendly and a few room challenges.
Summary: We stayed in 114 without AC, and the wobbly fan (fan fixed the day before we left).  It was unusually warm so this was a bummer. We had two young kids, 4 fans going, and stayed only because they cut the rate in half.  What was most disappointing is that the AC was out for some time prior to our visit and the owners knew it would not be fixed until after our stay.  In my opinion, they should have called us.  They made it palatable by agreeing to 1/2 rate we booked.  This place really is about the beach, a short stroll to play in the water, to eat, and then back to sleep. Coffee is first rate, staff is very kind and helpful.  Great to have the beach equipment and bikes right there. We had a good time without the AC.

This place has some things going for it- including a beautiful beach location. I think that's why you pay so much more than the rooms are worth. It's a small, beachy hotel. Nothing fancy. The air conditioner was broken for our entire 3 night stay. We asked them to cut the price in half and they did. We were not willing to stay here and pay full price. All the staff was accommodating and kind. We took full advantage of their boogie boards, sand toys, beach chairs, and umbrella daily! The rooms in back are larger and worked for two adults and two kids (daybed/trundle bed and a queen). The other rooms would have been impossible with more than 2 people.

Now that title could indicate either something good or something bad.  It all depends on what you are looking for.  If you are looking for a peaceful, upscale, 4 star boutique hotel / bed and breakfast, this would not meet your expectations.  If you are looking for a place to stay that is right on the beach in the heart of a bustling (and sometimes noisy) and busy public boardwalk that is convenient to several local bars, this may be just what you would expect.  The room itself was fairly nice, but the view was terrible which necessitated keeping the curtains closed.  The continental breakfast was a rather sparse.  The parking was expensive ($18 a day) and challenging to get in and out of.  It was nice that they offered bikes.  I appreciated them taking half off my room rate

We are spending $350 a night to stay in a suite (room 114), we walk in and the air conditioner says "system error".  I called the front desk and she tells me "Oh, yeah. We are having problems with the air back there.  Nothing we can do." She could have said something to me when I was checking in. She even called the hotel owners and they would not do anything about it.  While we were taking to the front desk person, she said that while we were taking about things, the jacuzzi bathtub does not work either.  When I turned the ceiling fan on high, the fan shook so hard, that I thought it was going to come flying off, not to mention the squeaking noises that you would not be able to sleep through. Make sure that you call before you book your room and ask specifically if there is

Clean, nicely renovated rooms, and steps from the beach - overall this hotel was nice. However, the website was a bit deceiving in that there were not any true "Ocean View Rooms" (partial view with windows that opened & across from a parking lot) and the Lobby and "Bar" areas left much to be desired as they were not overly inviting with minimal & uncomfortable furnishings - a few cozy leather chairs,books and games were redeeming elements though.

We stayed here one night in room 108 and really enjoyed ourselves. 250 a night plus 18 parking. a bit pricey but worth it to be so close to where we wanted to be. So delighted to step out of the hotel and practically be on the beach. Room was basic with the queen bed but had a dresser in the closet and a nice large bathtub. Staff was very polite and helpful when asking to borrow the chairs for the beach and to use the bikes to cruise along the beach the next morning. Loved sitting upstairs and looking out the beautiful window to see the beach and all the people before heading to bed. Hotel was quiet for us but heard someone else complain of a loud party next to them. Nice light breakfast the next morning. Would definitely come back again and recommend that others do the same.
Clean, adorable, comfortable, and right on the beach.  Parking is terrible, but everything else is fabulous!

This fabulous hotel is 2 steps from the beach in ultra casual, bohemian Newport Beach (no dressing up required here!!). It is a calm & delightful place in the midst of noise and craziness; the minute you step inside this charming hotel you feel welcome and relaxed.  Our basic room was small, with an open-plan bathroom and no opening window, but it was well furnished and comfortable, with the exception of the bed that had a plastic mattress cover making it very hot & sweaty!  There was only a fan to keep us cool as the a/c was managed by the front desk. There is a nice sitting area on the first floor with opening windows overlooking the beach and comfy chairs downstairs in front of a big screen TV.  The breakfast was plentiful and free hot drinks are available all day.  It was

Charm!!!!!!! Charm!!!!!! Charm!!!!!!!!!!!! What a wonderful place to stay!!!!!!!!!!! If you want a relaxing place just to get away this is the place!!!!!!!! Clean beautiful rooms!!!!!!! Wonderful friendly staff!!!!!! Absolutely Great!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Beware of noisy construction below of the hotel
Summary: I love the hotel's location. Although the rooms are rather small, the hotel is cute with a lot of character. I really love the sitting room in the upstairs lobby with a view of the ocean.   We booked the room for an overnight getaway. We were really looking forward to sleeping in followed by a stroll on the beach. Unfortunately, loud hammering sounds jolted us awake at 8:30 am. There's construction for a new restaurant right underneath our room!! The noise was so loud and the walls/floor so thin we could hear the workers talking and laughing as we tried to sleep. So much for a nice relaxing morning at the Newport Beach Hotel! Needless to say, we didn't get to relax and sleep in.   I'm so disappointed that our overnight getaway was ruined by this. The hotel had to have been aware

We had a wonderful stay at the Newport Beach Hotel.  We arrived early and they checked us right in.  In fact they upgraded us to a Oceanview room.  It was great.  The staff was so friendly and helpful.  Everything was within walking distance.  We used the hotels bikes and rode the boardwalk (a lot of fun).  I would highly recommend this hotel!  WE will be back soon!!!

Lovely people at the hotel. The Manager and, Front desk attendants and Housekeeper were friendly and attentive. The room was perfect with full view ocean view, clean and excellent decoration.  After our stay in the Hotel and the area we want to move to Newport Beach!

Summary Heading: Great stay at Newport Beach Hotel
Summary: My wife and I had a fantastic 5-night getaway at the Newport Beach Hotel. We were fortunate to have reserved an ocean-view room, right on the boardwalk (Ocean Ave), in close walking distance to an array of restaurants, bars, shops and cafes. Watching the surfers from our room never ceased to be fascinating (they arrive at sunrise -- all ages and stages, especially enjoyed seeing dads surfing with their kids before school). Our hotel room was nicely appointed, including a whirlpool bathtub. We especially appreciated hotel manager Kristina who was over-the-top warm and helpful -- referring us to authentic Italian and French eateries, Al Farro & Pescadou respectively. Weather was in the high 60's and low 70's, perfect for walking and biking along the ocean shores of Newport,
Great spot to stay on the beach, and I do mean on the beach.  On the weekends it is very busy on the beach.  Nice, cozy rooms.   Great spot for families.  Breakfast is lite but good.

Summary Heading: Convenience is the best thing about this hotel
Summary: We stayed for a few days and were initially impressed with the property. Nicely decorated and the location can't be beat if you wanna be on the sand. The bar next door can be annoying but it wasn't a huge intrusion. The hot water was out the first night we were there which was a pain but they discounted our room rate as compensation. Rooms were comfortable and clean, especially the larger rooms in the back of the property that have the fireplace.  The girl that worked the night shift was pleasant and helpful but the manager during the day seemed a little annoyed at times and did not give off the most welcoming feeling. That was more disappointing for us than not having hot water for the first night. I definitely appreciated the property but didn't feel appreciated by the

We stayed here in the Winter (Dec 2011), We were fortunate to have one of the ocean view rooms which was great for watching the beautiful sunset that night and it was so clear we could see Catalina Island. Great for close walking distance to all and great beach walk from the hotel south past the Pier and long walk to Balboa Pier. The fun place we went were to South Coast plaza, which has incredible Holiday decorations. Dinner at the Crab Cooker is just a stroll from the Hotel.  The only con was that this isn't a B&B style Four Sisters with the evening happy hour and great breakfast.  The ocean view room is great but may be noisy in the summer, also there's some happening bars (which contribute to the noise) but if you like beach bars, there's some good ones there.

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel; great location on the beach.
Summary: I stayed here in October 2011 with my 13 year old son.   We spent $50 to upgrade to a beachfront room and were so glad we did.  We enjoyed coffee while watching surfers in the morning and evening from our large beachfront window.  The front desk was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and we also borrowed boogie boards and bicycles to ride on the boardwalk.  Breakfast was continental.  Overall, a great find.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay with the Family
Summary: After having stayed in this hotel for the 1st time last week, my wife and I decided to come back out next year (2012) for our 40th birthdays and do it again.  The hotel exceeded our expectations.

The cleaning staff does a great job.  This hotel is right on the beach - no sand in our room, clean bedding and bathroom.  Recommend reserving either room 101 and 102 (have ocena views).  Be prepared for busy weekends with some noise, but week nights are quiet.  Fabulous location with reserved, gated parking.  Looking forward to nex stay!!

Summary Heading: The best location in Newport, but no windows!
Summary: The room was nice but too small; no place to put the luggage and it had no windows, just a sun light spot over the shower. The bathroom was also small, but there was a small jacuzi. There was just a tent dividing bathroom and room. The bed was small and not very comfortable. The parking was free, but a bit narrow if you have a big car. The stairs were also narrow and there was no elevator. The continental breakfast was free and good. The lobby had a large TV and place for reading. The staff was friendly but sometimes absent. The location was excellent: the hotel was close to bars and restourants if you want to enjoy a little nightlife in Newport, this is the right place even if it is pricey. Ask for a room with a window when you book.
Adorable room w great light nautical beach feel. Lived the bikes and beach chairs! Off to dinner we rode. Really sweet.

Very nice decor and location. Friendly and quaint considering its in very busy party part of Newport Beach. I see that as a plus as many bars are literally feet away. Bikes usually available and free which is a great way to see the peninsula. Friendly accomodating staff.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel and priced well for a beach front property
Summary: My wife and I had a mini vacation at this hotel and we have stayed here before. Kristina, the hotel manager went out of her way to amke our stay and a pleasant one. I have excema and need fresh air all the time. The room we booked had a window but it was stationary. The next night Kristina moved us to a better location with a window for no extra cost. If i had to be critical about this hotel is that I found the beds to be a little too soft for my taste. This however is a preference for me and others may not have an issue with it.  (my wife did not)  If you want to stay at a nice hotel on the beach that is not going to break your bank account doing so I would recomend you really need to check this hotel out. We are coming back here soon.

We stayed at this hotel as a family and for the price we had hoped for the price it wasn't a party hotel but were we wrong! I know the area is full of bars but the rented the room next door to us to college kids who were screaming and partying and when I went downstairs to ask nicely if they could just keep it down a little I was told to "be cool". We called management the next morning and were basically told so sad, to bad. I'm guessing the rotten service is the reason for the low rating on tripadvisor because the hotel is decorated in the perfect chic beach decor.
Manager Response: We are very sorry that the atmosphere in and around the hotel was not to your liking. Being in Newport Beach, CA, our hotel accomodates a wide variety of guests. We make every effort possible to ensure that everyone's stay at our hotel is enjoyable - from those guests that are looking for a quiet retreat, to those guests that are looking to celebrate special engagements.  Being part of the Four Sisters family of hotels, customer service is one of the most important aspects of our philosophy. We hope that your experiences will not completely prevent you from giving our hotel another opportunity to provide you with pleasurable accomodations.  Sincerely, Management

Summary Heading: Second time around; Second thumbs down!
Summary: We came to So. California to attend my grandson's high scool graduation.  Hotel check-in time was 3:00 p.m., which was perfect, as we needed time to shower and change before graduation began at 4:00 p.m.  We`arrived at 2:40 p.m. and were immediately checked-in and given a room key.  We took our luggage up to the room about 3:00 p.m. only to find it unmade and uncleaned.  We noticed that the couple who checked in ahead of us were standing in the hallway still waiting for their room to be cleaned.  I located the maids to inquire about the room and they still had seven rooms to clean and no guaranteed time when our room would be cleaned.  We were forced to leave the location at 3:30, drive to a nearby fast food location and get ready for graduation in their bathroom, obviously

If you are looking for an incredibly charming hotel AND great customer service from all the staff, look no further than the Newport Beach Hotel.  From the gorgeous hardwood floors to the beautiful showers - you will feel like you are well cared for from start to finish.  The manager, Kristina, is exceptional and she's obviously hired and trained the staff to make you their priority.  I took my son and his girlfriend for 5 days.  Incredibly location right on the beach - we had a fabulous time!  if you can, get the Oceanview rooms that look right out onto...  yes, the ocean!

First the positives:  The staff was wonderful.  Very friendly and helpful.  The location is very central for exploring Newport.  You can walk anywhere and just leave your car parked.  The negatives:  I think my expectations were high, knowing that it's part of the "4 sister's" chain.  The lobby was nice (clean and quaint), but I was not thrilled with the rooms.  We booked a Mariner room (the quiet side of the hotel..the other side is next to a very busy/ happening bar, Mutt Lynch's).  There are no windows, and the room is about as big as my closet.  The counter space is non existent, and I was unable to get ready for dinner as there was nowhere to set make-up or a hairdryer.  So, we opted for a very casual night out. I checked the mattress, as I always do at hotels, looking for

Summary Heading: Just a very pleasant feel to the hotel
Summary: There is a just a very pleasant feel to this hotel -- and it starts as soon as you walk through the front door.  Sunny and airy and relaxing.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The room appeared as it did on the Hotel's web page -- something you can't bank on.  The breakfast that was included was sufficient -- not a large selection but still very good.  I would definitely go back again.

Great, great, great!  If you want a simply amazing boutique hotel with a fantastic location on Newport Beach then look no further.  We had a great room that was spacious and fresh. The view was incredible. I would also like to note that the manager went out of her way to make our stay just a little bit extra special.

Despite some questionable reviews, we decided to try the Newport Beach Hotel and were glad we did. The room was comfortable and perfect for a good night's sleep, the continental breakfast more than  met our needs, and the hotel itself was ideally located situated (right on the beach). The staff were exceedingly helpful! One concern we had was a previous review that mentioned noise from the bar downstairs ... to be accurate, the bar was next door and didn't interfere with our stay in the least. We slept with the window open (to hear the wave action of the ocean) and were not disturbed. We stayed in an oceanview room, which is pricier than some alternatives, but were not disappointed. We would endorse this property as a good choice if one wants to be right on the beach and in a

My husband and I live locally and wanted a romantic getaway....and we definitely found it at the Newport Beachwalk Hotel. We booked the ocean view suite, which was WELL worth the extra money, and loved it! We were able to check in early and the room was everything we expected. The jacuzzi tub was wonderful and could soak in the tub while watching the action on the beach. We relaxed in the chairs in front of the window, sipped some wine and watched the sunset! We literally were just a few yards from beach and could hear the sound of the waves crashing. The bed was also very comfortable and the staff was welcoming and accommodating. We look forward to returning to this quaint and cozy hotel!

Summary Heading: Kristina, the manager, took excellent care of us!
Summary: Although it rained all three days of our visit, Kristina made sure we had a good time.  She recommended restaurants, lent us bikes, and even found a cabbie who got us to the airport in record time.  She even upgraded our room at no extra charge when she noticed we were cramped for space.  Being right on the beach was fantastic!

Summary Heading: Hotel Staff Single Handedly Ruined My Vacation
Summary: I can honestly say that I have never been more offended by the staff at a hotel in my life.  I travel significant amounts each year and have never met a staff as incompetent as this one.  The Manager, katy or kristine was completely useless and rude.  I would never stay at this hotel again for this alone.  Not to mention that the place is a dump.

Summary Heading: LOVE this place, so charming and special...
Summary: I was a little hesitant at first to stay here because my boyfriend and I were looking for a place that had a pool and the Newport Beach Hotel does not have one. But what a great choice we made! It was so charming and so well put together. We immediately felt warmed and thrilled by the environment, lobby (with it's antique wood bar and fireplace) and room. The building itself is historic and was completely renovated. The design is rustic modern but very classy and has an "inn-like" feel. Our room, with it's blue and white colors, white paneled walls and sailing pictures faced the beach. The jacuzzi was encased in glass but was on a platform so that the ocean and beach can be viewed right from the jacuzzi! We viewed a couple of the other rooms that were doubles or singles and they

The Newport Beach Hotel is literally a few steps away from the beach and the Pacific Ocean. This is one of the many aspects of the hotel which make it a fantastic place to have found! We received a really warm welcome from the reception team on our arrival at the refurbished beach front hotel. Our room was really homely and we loved the open plan style of the space, with the whirlpool bath being enclosed within a glass wall within the room. A rare treat was having an actual key for our room rather than a swipe card which again made the hotel feel like a home away from home. The Hotel offers free access to the internet and an extensive complimentary breakfast each morning which can be enjoyed in the lounge area which has uninterrupted views over the ocean. The Hotel offers secure

Summary Heading: Not quite as expected for the money
Summary: The room we were given had to be the smallest one they had and the bathroom was the smallest bathroom I have ever been in.  If you wanted to use the toilet your knees would hit the bathroom door when it was closed.  There was no bathtub just a shower and the shower was so close to the toilet that you had to open the shower door first and then step around the toilet to get in.  It was extremely small and I would never stay in a room with a bathroom like that again.  The room was right above a nightclub so all the party noise was heard.  The two nice things about this room is that the bed was extremely comfortable and the parking was in the back and was gated.  Also you could walk right out of the hotel and be on the beach.  Overall for the money we spent I wouldn't stay there

Summary Heading: Walk out your door onto the beach...or watch the action from your room
Summary: We loved this hotel.   The room was squeaky clean, the old paneling and woodwork spotlessly maintained.  We gazed onto the beach from our bathtub.  We threw open our windows and listened to the waves crashing through the night.  We paid extra for the beach-facing room and it was well worth it.  Early morning, we sat at our window watching the surfers out on their boards,  families arriving for a day in the sun, little kids squealing with delight.  We borrowed the hotel's bikes and pedaled along the boardwalk all day.  Late in the evening, we were back in our window watching the nightlife (I'm over 60...been there, done that...happy to just watch it unfold!!), hearing the strains of the rock band down the block....watching all those beautiful young people out on the town.  The
worst hotel i have ever been to, the staff is rude the rooms were dirty and it sits on top of a bar.  super loud.  way to expensive for a headache

Summary Heading: I look forward to coming back here again!
Summary: The staff at the Newport Beach Hotel were fantastic!  The hotel is in a great location on the beach.  Sunday it was 80 degrees out and I was able to use one of their bicycles to ride up and down the beach.  I look forward to staying at this hotel again soon!

Summary Heading: Like sleeping in a closet in the back of a bar
Summary: This hotel looked great from the front of the building, however when i checked in i was seriously dissapointed.  The front desk staff is rude, the room was small and didnt even have a window, and worst of all it is right next to a bar which pumps music  through the entire hotel.  worst nights sleep i ever got.  Not worth the money!!!!!!

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a getaway because we were impressed by its beautiful location but upon arrival we were completely disappointed.  We checked in ( or tried to) a little after midnight and couldn't even get in the front door.  We looked through the window and saw the front desk person asleep on the couch.  After knocking on the door the person woke up and checked us in.  Once in the room we realized that there was one window that looked out into the side of a building.  There was zero natural light in the room and the window didnt even open.  Things got even worse when we woke up in the morning.  The bath tub didnt even have hot water.  I called down to the front desk and got no answer.  I walked down to the desk and rang the bell at the counter and waited.

Summary Heading: This place is the perfect beach hotel.
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a leisure weekend.  Although it rained Friday night and Saturday morning, it was still beautiful.  This hotel is across from the beach, only thing between you and the beach is the parking lot.  So yes the rooms are not huge, they are the typical beach house rooms. But the hotel is quaint, homey and VERY clean.  We stayed in a room with a jacuzzi tub, and a block glass window.  The tub is under a sky light, with the block glass behind it so a lot of light was in the room, the sky light held up againist VERY heavy rains so despite some of the reviews it was stable.  My boyfriend and I loved this hotel, and we will stay again.  Next time we will get the room that has the big window looking out to the beach.  What we enjoyed the most was the seating area

This hotel looks so great in the pictures, but don't be mislead as we were.  We reserved a "deluxe room" and decided to splurge and stay by the beach.   While the views are spectacular, the room we stayed in was not.  We paid, in total with $18.00 parking, over  $ 200.00 for the nite.    Our room was no bigger than a small bedroom.  While the furniture was lovely, the room itself was inadequate.  The bed was very close to the door, which made you feel as if you were very close to the noisy hallway.     My biggest complaint, and oh what a complaint it was, was the fact that you could hear every door open, every word spoken, every toilet flushed, every shower taken.  The door to our room felt as safe as a door to a bedroom which did not make us feel as if we'd  "gotten away" for

This hotel is a stones throw from the beach which was great. Manager was so friendly and helpful, although other receptionist we encountered was a bit moody.  Our room seemed a bit basic, wish we had paid more and stayed in better room.
If you like personal service, the beach at your doorstep and 1st class accomodations, this is the spot for you. It's a great selection for any occasion and a rare find in the LA area.

Summary Heading: this place was crap for a $200.oo one night stay
Summary: let me begin with the fact that we were not greeted with the customer service most customers are entitled to. Second, there is no free parking. The clerk offered us a $17.00 parking spot out back.  Also,Don't be a sucker to their false advertising pictures of their luxurous rooms. Our room was nothing like the ones that Newport BeachWalk featured on their website. ANd you would think after paying $200.oo at least my girlfriend and I would get a great contimental breakfeast. All this placed offered was a muffin and coffee. : (...we expected at least choices. overall, it is convient to be right on the beach, but face it, your not getting what you pay for here. book else where.

Summary Heading: Great little spot.  Right on the beach!
Summary: This was the last hotel my girlfriend and I stayed in at the end of a 14 day road trip.  The location was fantastic, right on the beach.  We stayed in an oceanfront room with a clear view of the pier and beach.  Sara at the front desk was outstanding, she even went next door to pick up pizza for us!  Great little spot, would definetely come again (if it wasn't so far from Vancouver)!

Summary Heading: Disappointing and misleading for a Four Sisters Inn
Summary: My husband and I stayed here one night for our anniversary.  This hotel is a member of the Four Sisters Inns bed & breakfast group so we had certain expectations. We have stayed in 4 of their other inns in the past and have always been more than satisfied.  But this time we were very disappointed. We only had one night away so we chose not to complain about anything so as not to spoil our time.  (In fact we didn't even talk about our disappointments until our drive home!)  First let me say that the hotel is in a fantastic location, right on the boardwalk near the Newport Pier so you have the beach & fun restaurants within walking/biking  distance.  The buidling is nice, the rooms have hardwood floors and flat screen t.v.s.  But there are other choices nearby that I would try

Summary Heading: Thank You All At Newport Beachwalk
Summary: A very class act. Very professional and curtious.My room was even nicer than I expected. Very clean and comfortable.I will tell all my friends to consider this great place when traveling . Like being at home but on a beautiful beach.I had a pleasant  stay and will return. Thanks

The quaint Newport Beachwalk Hotel is a gem of a  resort hotel. The courteous staff and well appointed lodgings are only a few of the merits of this wonderful little hotel...... right on one of California's highest  rated beaches. A really nice "year-round" destination !

My wife and I enjoyed 8 days at the hotel soaking in the beach life and the best Newport has to offer.  Up-to-date rooms with all the amendities, a very nice staff, and the location on the beach makes the Newport Beachwalk Hotel a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: I'll stay here on all my return trips.
Summary: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. The room was clean and comfortable, and while the massive shower which seemed to be part of the bedroom was initially intimidating (since my platonic friend and I were rooming together) the privacy curtain did the trick. The staff was friendly, helpful and very accomodating. They let us use their hotel bikes even after we'd checked out. I recommend this property. Great value, great location, great, great, great!

Summary Heading: European Style Bed and Breakfast on a CA beach - outstanding experience!
Summary: Great place for East Coast traveler to sit in the morning to take your EST calls - sitting at the ocean for breakfast. On beach. Close to great food and great sports bar (Mutts). All the nightlife you could want. Great staff and housekeeping team. Close to all business venues in OC and a reasonable hop on the 73  tollway to San Diego as well.

My wife and I have stayed here many times and its always a treat.  Wonderful rooms, spectacular location, and a truly enjoyable staff.  Mike the manager was especially gracious.  We will definately return soon.

Summary Heading: Outstanding service, breathtaking view of the ocean and great place to jog.
Summary: The staff is so exemplary in service.  They go out of their way to remember my name, to store things for me (i'm a regular) and make great recommendations for dinner spots.  I feel like the Newport Beach Hotel is my second home.  I recommed the two rooms on the ocean, jogging down the boardwalk in the morning and having a cup of their delicious coffee.

Summary Heading: Clean,comfortable,helpful,and the perfect location for the beach
Summary: My thirteen year old granddaughterher ,her friend and i spent three days in August 2009 at the Newport Beachwalk Hotel.  I wanted this to be the perfect California beach trip for my granddaughter and her best friend. The Beachwalk lived up to my expectations, being a sixty-two year old, and at the same time impressed the young teenagers!  Beach chairs and towels were provided for daily. The beach was just steps away, allowing me to feel comfortable leaving the girls on the beach suntaning to run back to the room for a few minutes.  Mike, at the front desk was most helpful in getting our tickets for the boat ride to Catalina Island, as well as printing our boarding passes for the airlines on the day that we left.  Kristin was also very cheerful.  I had requested early check-in ,

Summary Heading: Newport Beachwalk Hotel (Formerly the Portofino), A great stay.
Summary: Just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay here. I will also post this review under the hotel entry 'Newport Beach Hotel'. TA staff should merge these 2 together, since they are the same hotel. This used to be called The Portofino, but is now called the Newport BeachWalk Hotel. (not Newport Beach Hotel).  Laguna was our beach of choice, until we discovered Newport.  This hotel is directly on the beach.  It's in a very lively area, with many bars and little shops all directly outside the hotel.  We parked in the hotel lot ($18.00 per night) and didn't get back in our car until the day of departure. We wanted this vacation to be without a schedule, and just take in the local sights and scenes. Newport Beachwalk Hotel did not dissapoint in that regard.  It's a wonderful little 15

Summary Heading: Go someplace else and visit beach in daytime!
Summary: This was an expensive, cramped, cold, loud, mistake (with a rotten breakfast).  I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anybody that I even sorta liked.  It is in a nice location, for about 2 seconds. Sleeping isn't an option. We were in room 107 and it was stuffy and very loud. And the bathroom was teeny tiny.  If you are bigger than a size 6 you might not fit in the bathroom! Oh, the AC didn't turn off and our room was 56 degrees when we woke up shivering.  The women that checked us in was rude, and she was rude to her coworkers. When I asked if there was internet access in the rooms I was told yes. That isn't the case. The continental breakfast consisted of Lipton tea,  nasty, soggy Costco muffins and, extra soggy croissants.  All this can be yours for $200 a night. And don't ask
Manager Response: We apologize for your stay being less than enjoyable. We have since fixed the AC/Heat issues in room 107.  We see that you stayed with us in 2009. We apologize for the staff interaction that you had during your stay and we can assure you that new management (Four Sisters Inns) and staff that are dedicated to exceptional customer service have been added to the team here at the Newport Beach Hotel.  We hope that some time in the future you will give us an opportunity to show you how important our service is to our entire team. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Excellent location but missing alot of standard amenities..........
Summary: The location is perfect if you want to be close to beach,pier ,and restaurants.  The bed was clean and very comfortable.  Decor was great but bathroom fixtures were old inside a marble shower???!!!!.  Our room was very small had only one square mirror, no hairdryer, coffeemaker missing carafe, iron not working, breakfast service was weak and coffee was empty with no employee in sight to refill.  Staff was somewhat friendly and parking was $18/per day not $8 as my confirmation said!  Location is defintely the main reason to stay here!

Summary Heading: great location, nice staff, bad plumbing
Summary: Our room had no windows but was still over $200 a night.  The bath was an oversized jetted tub, surrounded by a glass enclosure and was one of reasons we chose the hotel.  Unfortunately when I tried to fill the tub the pipes knocked loudly--so loudly that they must have been clearly audible downstairs at the front desk-- and no water appeared.  The shower worked but the tub never really got warm because by the time the shower filled up the tub, the water was cooled.  We only stayed one day, and at checkout I mentioned the plumbing problem and the fact that we never did really get to use the tub, but there was no suggestion of a discounted rate due to the limited amenities, which would have been appreciated. Otherwise, the room furnishings were pleasant, except that the tv remote

The Inn is nicely decorated and very clean.  It is in a great location, our room had a partial ocean view and you can fall asleep to the sounds of the ocean.   The downside is that there are stairs even in the room, our room was divided by stairs.  I assume they did this to capitalize on the view but in unfamiliar surroundings stairs are not great.  Also the stairs from the parking area are slippery when wet and steep.  The bathroom is the smallest I have ever seen, approx 3x5, this is not a typo.  It actually was not a problem for us but if you are larger than average or even mildly disabled you are going to have a serious problem.  Walking through the hotel we noticed some different room set ups, so just ask questions and be aware.

Summary Heading: Disappointing, Lack the basics despite great location
Summary: This place is very well located for a beach vacation with many eateries within walking distance - but I can't say the food is any good (one time, the fish tasted like cardboard and another night pasta had no flavor other than cream and old dried herbs - this is acceptable in the middle of winter in the blizzard states but hello, this is SoCal at 70F!).   Cute cozy looking room upon entry. But being above a restaurant, it smelled too much like a kitchen rather than a clean room. Late at night (around midnight or later) the process of the restaurant shutting down is loud w/ chairs banging, etc.I wondered what the ruckus was about the first night and when happened it every night....  The bedding is of pretty decent quality though the comforter looked lumpy already. Decent couch to

Ok, i had room 102, which has the full ocean view, i believe that is the only room with the full ocean view (not sure).. .The problem is that the beach is so busy!! Im mean till 2am ppl were still flooding the beach like it was daytime! So i didnt feel comfortable leaving my curtains open... The room was expensive but i guess you are paying all that cos you are right on the beach. It is definately not a 5 star hotel..It is kinda like a Holiday Inn in my opinion...Nothing special. If you dont mind a 2 star hotel on a loud beach, themn you shouldnt have any problems here!
Manager Response: You are absolutely correct. Newport Beach is a very busy beach, especially during the summer months. There are always many beach goers during the day and plenty of people enjoying the nightlife when the sun goes down.  Room 101 and 102 are our oceanfront rooms. The windows on the front of the rooms (that face the water) have a mirrored effect, so they do provide some privacy from anyone attempting to look in from the outside.  We see that you stayed in July, which is one of the busiest months here in Newport Beach. Luckily in Southern California, we enjoy fairly mild weather year-round and the crowds of people diminish greatly in the non-summer months. If you ever have another chance to visit Newport Beach, look into our availability in either the September/October or February/March timeframes. The weather is still gorgeous and the beach is much less populated. Thank you.

Summary: This is one of the worst experiences my wife and I have had.  The noise only stopped when my wife threatened the people that we were going to call the police. This was about 2:30 AM.  No help from the hotel.  They also never issued our 4:30 wake up call.   I had asked the hotel help that the manager/owner call me and no call.  When I called back and talked to the manager, she was rude and would not take any responsibility for the miserable night we had to spend.  Told me that we booked through hotel.com so too bad.    My wife and I are really disappointed because the hotel is quite nice but the treatment we received was actually horrible.
Manager Response: We would like to apologize for the experiences you had at the hotel. Although we are not the management team that was at the hotel when you stayed here, we still realize how awful it must have been to receive that kind of service, or lack thereof.  The management team now in place at the hotel (as of approximately 1.5 years ago) is that of the Four Sisters Inns. We specialize in boutique hotel accomodations up and down the west coast of the United States. Customer service and guest relations are our top priorities. If you ever find yourself in the area again, please come by the hotel, introduce yourselves to our staff and you will immediately see the difference. Thank you.

Summary: As a frequent business traveller from the UK, I was keen to sample a genuine local hotel.  I also wanted some fresh air and thinking space.  This unassuming looking hotel is small, clean and in a terrific location.  Newly refurbished, the rooms are smart and simple, designed for weekend vacations; the bed was one of the most comfortable I have recently experienced, with wonderful linens, pillows, etc, though the bathroom was small.  Even more impressive is the location; in the heart of the ocean front, close to the pier, there really is no other way to quickly become part of a local beach community.  Take brunch or pick from one of many different beers in Mutt Lynch's next door, sit at the bar and chat to the locals, or buy a donut & coffee and eat it on the pier.  Or simply

I had booked a room at the "Portofino" and showed up to find out that new owners had bought and completely rennovated it, including a new name "The Newport Beach Hotel."  The hotel is right on the beach and the remodeling has transformed this quaint little place I have enjoyed for years into a luxory destination.  Our room had the finest of amenities, including a very comfortable pillowtop mattress, large plasma tv, hard wood floors and a great ocean view.  It still has all the old charm that has brought me here before but now it also has modern comforts which it lacked before.    I can't wait to go back again.

We were walk-in guests to this hotel and were provided two room choices, a large room over looking the ocean or a larger room in the back with a $40 differential, views were more expensive.  We enjoyed our location, the size of the room, and the comforts of the hotel and found the staff accommodating and friendly.  The areas that need a quick improvement are primarily maintenance issuses, new carpet for one or a very serious deep cleaning. Both rooms we looked at would not encourage bare footedness. A new paint job, attention to the skylight leak damage and so on.   The parking is no longer free, although the brochure they use indicates that it is.  We ate at the attached restaurant, Re'nato and had a fabulous meal, a little high priced, but balanced with the 15% discount

I found the Portofino Hotel a bit of a dump, not "quaint", "full of character" or "European". On the plus side, it was near the beach.  That's about it.  Our room had no windows, looked like it hadn't been decorated since 1952, was tiny and smelt. And we already changed rooms once. The bathroom was small and dirty.
