The staff were largely anonymous, breakfast inedible and the local bars and restaurants memorable only due the extortionate prices and sulking barmen. What made in worse was the price! $100 for that? $40 would have been more reasonable. Apparently it's now under new management. Hopefully they'll gut it and start again.
Manager Response: We are no longer the Portofino Hotel. We are now the Newport Beach Hotel, part of the Four Sisters Inns family. There is completely new ownership and management. The hotel was also completely renovated approximately 4 years ago. Thank you.

Summary: I just got back from my stay at the Portofino and found that the hotel had a great location. Although the rooms need a little work I was pleased to meet the new owner and to find they have plans to upgade the hotel over the winter. The new owner, who was a pleasent young man, understood customer service and made my stay here one of the best little getaways we've ever had. I can't wait to go back next year and see what they have done with the place.

I reserved a room at this motel through Travel Now.   When we got to the motel the peson behind the desk told me that there was no room in my name.   I had to find a room for that night.   When I got home from my vacation I found that I was still charged for the three nights I was supposed to have a reservation for.   I have tried to get the motel and the manager to tell TravelNow what happened when I got there and they keep telling TN I stayed in the motel all three days (when we did not).  I can not get the manager to tell the truth.  The picures on the net are also about 6-7 years old.  The web says that there is an nice reasturaunt but it is an open are bar.   When we got there at 3:00 pm it was already loud and roudy.  I'm sure it is even louder at night.   I do not
Manager Response: We are no longer the Portofino Hotel. We are now the Newport Beach Hotel, part of the Four Sisters Inns family. There is completely new ownership and management. The hotel was also completely renovated approximately 4 years ago. Thank you.

Summary: The staff is helpful and the rooms are comfortable and quaint.  We have stayed here three or four times over the last year.  Every visit has been enjoyable.  This and the Doryman are the only on the beach hotels in Newport Beach.  That is what really brings us back here, the beach location.  We are five star Ritz Hotel types and enjoy the homey friendly feel of this small hotel.  Recommended, just don't set your expectations too high.

We first went with the cheaper room, but when we arrived discovered it was interior and did not have an opening window.  I forget to check this from time to time and I regret it.  I like fresh air and climate control (there was no temperture control in the room that we could find).  We asked for another room and we were upgraded to a $250 per night suite.  It had  french patio doors, and deck up a steep ladder on the roof along with a hot tub.  The hotel is right on the beach and near some nice casual restaurants.  There is a place to rent surf boards, or just "belly board" for us tourists.  Very relaxing place.  Ask about specifics of the room if you like to open a window.

It's not terrible, but its not what I could consider average. A very small TV, the Cable Service kept going out. no window in my room, not heat/ac controls. The bedspread was dirty, as were the pillow shams. The wall paper had many rips in it near the chairs. The shower curtian had mold and mildew on it.  The shower head put out a poor stream of water. The sheet on the bed had a 10 inch tear in it. We tried to do our part and put some towels on the rack for re-use, but even the ones we left on the floor were not replaced when the "cleaned" the room.   It was unique, it could be cute with the above things fixed.  The good things were the in room hot tub. There was plenty of hot water to fill it up. It is on the beach, tne beach is beautiful. I doubt I will ever go back to this
Manager Response: We are no longer the Portofino Hotel. We are now the Newport Beach Hotel, part of the Four Sisters Inns family. There is completely new ownership and management. The hotel was also completely renovated approximately 4 years ago. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Like a small hotel in Venice, good AND bad
Summary: I stayed at the PBH in October '04, and thought I'd share my perspective, given the very wide range of opinions expressed on this site.  First off, you're probably considering the PBH because of its location, right near the Newport Pier, facing the beach. It's fabulous.  The hotel itself is unique, and quite unlike any other hotel I have stayed in, in North America. It reminds me like nothing so much as one of the small 2/3-star hotels in Venice: quirky adaptations of old structures, now converted to hotel use.  I had a room on the north side (even numbers), which just like others have pointed out, means no windows (just a glass block wall and skylight, with no effective light control, not a problem this time of year, but maybe an issue in the summer in the early morning). The

My husband and I stayed at the Portofino for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon in a roma suite.  Our favorite part of the suite was the large jacuzzi tub and the sundeck on the roof (it really felt like we were in Italy)!  The room was large and uniquely furnished.  From our window we could see some ocean too!  The location is wonderful being right by the beach and within walking distance to many great restaurants (it does get pretty crowded on the weekends)!  We had a wonderful time!    The only drawbacks were the carpet was a bit stained/worn-looking in places and the parking lot was small with really tight spaces (had to park elsewhere one night, but the clerk showed us where to go).

Summary Heading: Unique Hotel And Hospitality On The Beach
Summary: We very much enjoyed the Portofino. It's something in-between a small hotel and a B&B. We had a Firenze room with a  big Jacuzzi. There was plenty of light from the skylight even without a window. The room was cozy and had a nice decor, as did the common areas and lobby,  like an Italian villa of sorts. The other guests were friendly, and the concierge/clerks were great! Friendly, helpful and fun. Saul, Sal and Keith are to be commended. Nice place right on the beach, well maybe 30 yards away. Re Nato, next door was a good Italian restaurant, but they need a maitre d' to coordinate some service difficulties. Stop at Newport Beach for sun, surf, Balboa Island, the Crab Cooker,  and stay at the Portofino.

Summary Heading: Quaint B&B offers good service and clean product
Summary: What a great location and very quaint bed and breakfast hotel.  The product was very clean and the people were really nice and helpful.  I stayed for the entire weekend and had everything at my fingertips.  The overall experience was more than I expected and I would recommend this quite and cozy spot to anyone.

Summary Heading: Sleeping on the couch at Portofino Beach Hotel
Summary: My husband and I were looking forward to a romantic weekend in Newport Beach. We booked the Portofino Beach Hotel at the last minute. They had one room left, described as Queen bed with in room Jacuzzi. The fee was $200. When we got there, late at night after sailing and dining, we saw that the room had NO WINDOWS at all, only a wall of glass bricks through which some daylight came in. There was a set of Levolor blinds to shield some of that light, but they were broken. Management couldn't fix them, so they hung a blanket. That was ugly, but workable. The jacuzzi in the next room also made our room completely vibrate for 45 minutes and we couldn't get to sleep at all. What wasn't even remotely acceptable was that there was no individual climate control and everything was
Manager Response: This is an update because we are no longer the Portofino Hotel. We are now the Newport Beach Hotel, part of the Four Sisters Inns family (as of approximately 1.5 years ago). The hotel was completely renovated approximately 4 years ago. There is no longer any affiliation with the way the hotel once looked, felt, or quality of service provided. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Quaint, in the middle of everything
Summary: With all of the antiques and Victorian flourishes, the hotel reminds me of the kind of hotel you'd stay in along the Jersey shore.  The room was small but clean and very cute.  I thought the bed was really firm and comfortable; my husband hated it and didn't sleep at all.  The skylights in the room give off a ton of light to make up for the lack of windows.  Since the hotel is literally right in the middle of the Newport Beach Boardwalk area, traffic is kind of a nightmare.  Definitely not the place to go for peace and quiet, but a great alternative if you want to party in Newport.  I felt like I was right in the middle of Mission Beach in San Diego.  The parking lot is convenient if you have a reasonably-sized car; not the place for a suburban or a Hummer2.  The concierge there

Summary Heading: Lots of character and sweet location
Summary: The Portofino is in an awesome location - right on the bike path in Newport Beach and within walking distance of lots of food, bars, and a few shops. Sort of a beach/party atmosphere in the area - lots of packed casual bars with twenty-something aged locals. I'd say this is a plus if you are looking to party but not much of a problem if you want to avoid it (like my wife and I did). The hotel has lots of character although the rooms are quite small. Our room not only lacked an ocean view but a window of any kind. However, a cool skylight provided plenty of light. Upstairs lobby area has a great ocean view. Included breakfast was quite sparse (some muffins and fruit) but the area in which it is served is quite nice. We ate at the restaurant at the hotel - food was above average
